  2242   /* TB is the sblock we copy to, TO is the sdata within TB we copy
  2243      to, and TB_END is the end of TB.  */
  2244   struct sblock *tb = oldest_sblock;
  2245   if (tb)
  2246     {
  2247       sdata *tb_end = (sdata *) ((char *) tb + SBLOCK_SIZE);
  2248       sdata *to = tb->data;
  2249 
  2250       /* Step through the blocks from the oldest to the youngest.  We
  2251          expect that old blocks will stabilize over time, so that less
  2252          copying will happen this way.  */
  2253       struct sblock *b = tb;
  2254       do
  2255         {
  2256           sdata *end = b->next_free;
  2257           eassert ((char *) end <= (char *) b + SBLOCK_SIZE);
  2258 
  2259           for (sdata *from = b->data; from < end; )
  2260             {
  2261               /* Compute the next FROM here because copying below may
  2262                  overwrite data we need to compute it.  */
  2263               ptrdiff_t nbytes;
  2264               struct Lisp_String *s = from->string;
  2265 
  2266 #ifdef GC_CHECK_STRING_BYTES
  2267               /* Check that the string size recorded in the string is the
  2268                  same as the one recorded in the sdata structure.  */
  2269               if (s && string_bytes (s) != SDATA_NBYTES (from))
  2270                 emacs_abort ();
  2271 #endif /* GC_CHECK_STRING_BYTES */
  2272 
  2273               nbytes = s ? STRING_BYTES (s) : SDATA_NBYTES (from);
  2274               eassert (nbytes <= LARGE_STRING_BYTES);
  2275 
  2276               ptrdiff_t size = sdata_size (nbytes);
  2277               sdata *from_end = (sdata *) ((char *) from
  2278                                            + size + GC_STRING_EXTRA);
  2279 
  2280 #ifdef GC_CHECK_STRING_OVERRUN
  2281               if (memcmp (string_overrun_cookie,
  2282                           (char *) from_end - GC_STRING_OVERRUN_COOKIE_SIZE,
  2283                           GC_STRING_OVERRUN_COOKIE_SIZE))
  2284                 emacs_abort ();
  2285 #endif
  2286 
  2287               /* Non-NULL S means it's alive.  Copy its data.  */
  2288               if (s)
  2289                 {
  2290                   /* If TB is full, proceed with the next sblock.  */
  2291                   sdata *to_end = (sdata *) ((char *) to
  2292                                              + size + GC_STRING_EXTRA);
  2293                   if (to_end > tb_end)
  2294                     {
  2295                       tb->next_free = to;
  2296                       tb = tb->next;
  2297                       tb_end = (sdata *) ((char *) tb + SBLOCK_SIZE);
  2298                       to = tb->data;
  2299                       to_end = (sdata *) ((char *) to + size + GC_STRING_EXTRA);
  2300                     }
  2301 
  2302                   /* Copy, and update the string's `data' pointer.  */
  2303                   if (from != to)
  2304                     {
  2305                       eassert (tb != b || to < from);
  2306                       ASAN_PREPARE_LIVE_SDATA (to, nbytes);
  2307                       memmove (to, from, size + GC_STRING_EXTRA);
  2308                       to->string->u.s.data = SDATA_DATA (to);
  2309                     }
  2310 
  2311                   /* Advance past the sdata we copied to.  */
  2312                   to = to_end;
  2313                 }
  2314               from = from_end;
  2315             }
  2316           b = b->next;
  2317         }
  2318       while (b);
  2319 
  2320       /* The rest of the sblocks following TB don't contain live data, so
  2321          we can free them.  */
  2322       for (b = tb->next; b; )
  2323         {
  2324           struct sblock *next = b->next;
  2325           lisp_free (b);
  2326           b = next;
  2327         }
  2328 
  2329       tb->next_free = to;
  2330       tb->next = NULL;
  2331     }
  2332 
  2333   current_sblock = tb;
  2334 }
  2335 
  2336 void
  2337 string_overflow (void)
  2338 {
  2339   error ("Maximum string size exceeded");
  2340 }
  2341 
  2342 static Lisp_Object make_clear_string (EMACS_INT, bool);
  2343 static Lisp_Object make_clear_multibyte_string (EMACS_INT, EMACS_INT, bool);
  2344 
  2345 DEFUN ("make-string", Fmake_string, Smake_string, 2, 3, 0,
  2346        doc: /* Return a newly created string of length LENGTH, with INIT in each element.
  2347 LENGTH must be an integer.
  2348 INIT must be an integer that represents a character.
  2349 If optional argument MULTIBYTE is non-nil, the result will be
  2350 a multibyte string even if INIT is an ASCII character.  */)
  2351   (Lisp_Object length, Lisp_Object init, Lisp_Object multibyte)
  2352 {
  2353   Lisp_Object val;
  2354   EMACS_INT nbytes;
  2355 
  2356   CHECK_FIXNAT (length);
  2357   CHECK_CHARACTER (init);
  2358 
  2359   int c = XFIXNAT (init);
  2360   bool clearit = !c;
  2361 
  2362   if (ASCII_CHAR_P (c) && NILP (multibyte))
  2363     {
  2364       nbytes = XFIXNUM (length);
  2365       val = make_clear_string (nbytes, clearit);
  2366       if (nbytes && !clearit)
  2367         {
  2368           memset (SDATA (val), c, nbytes);
  2369           SDATA (val)[nbytes] = 0;
  2370         }
  2371     }
  2372   else
  2373     {
  2374       unsigned char str[MAX_MULTIBYTE_LENGTH];
  2375       ptrdiff_t len = CHAR_STRING (c, str);
  2376       EMACS_INT string_len = XFIXNUM (length);
  2377 
  2378       if (ckd_mul (&nbytes, len, string_len))
  2379         string_overflow ();
  2380       val = make_clear_multibyte_string (string_len, nbytes, clearit);
  2381       if (!clearit)
  2382         {
  2383           unsigned char *beg = SDATA (val), *end = beg + nbytes;
  2384           for (unsigned char *p = beg; p < end; p += len)
  2385             {
  2386               /* First time we just copy STR to the data of VAL.  */
  2387               if (p == beg)
  2388                 memcpy (p, str, len);
  2389               else
  2390                 {
  2391                   /* Next time we copy largest possible chunk from
  2392                      initialized to uninitialized part of VAL.  */
  2393                   len = min (p - beg, end - p);
  2394                   memcpy (p, beg, len);
  2395                 }
  2396             }
  2397         }
  2398     }
  2399 
  2400   return val;
  2401 }
  2402 
  2403 /* Fill A with 1 bits if INIT is non-nil, and with 0 bits otherwise.
  2404    Return A.  */
  2405 
  2406 Lisp_Object
  2407 bool_vector_fill (Lisp_Object a, Lisp_Object init)
  2408 {
  2409   EMACS_INT nbits = bool_vector_size (a);
  2410   if (0 < nbits)
  2411     {
  2412       unsigned char *data = bool_vector_uchar_data (a);
  2413       int pattern = NILP (init) ? 0 : (1 << BOOL_VECTOR_BITS_PER_CHAR) - 1;
  2414       ptrdiff_t nbytes = bool_vector_bytes (nbits);
  2415       int last_mask = ~ (~0u << ((nbits - 1) % BOOL_VECTOR_BITS_PER_CHAR + 1));
  2416       memset (data, pattern, nbytes - 1);
  2417       data[nbytes - 1] = pattern & last_mask;
  2418     }
  2419   return a;
  2420 }
  2421 
  2422 /* Return a newly allocated, uninitialized bool vector of size NBITS.  */
  2423 
  2424 Lisp_Object
  2425 make_uninit_bool_vector (EMACS_INT nbits)
  2426 {
  2427   Lisp_Object val;
  2428   EMACS_INT words = bool_vector_words (nbits);
  2429   EMACS_INT word_bytes = words * sizeof (bits_word);
  2430   EMACS_INT needed_elements = ((bool_header_size - header_size + word_bytes
  2431                                 + word_size - 1)
  2432                                / word_size);
  2433   if (PTRDIFF_MAX < needed_elements)
  2434     memory_full (SIZE_MAX);
  2435   struct Lisp_Bool_Vector *p
  2436     = (struct Lisp_Bool_Vector *) allocate_vector (needed_elements);
  2437   XSETVECTOR (val, p);
  2438   XSETPVECTYPESIZE (XVECTOR (val), PVEC_BOOL_VECTOR, 0, 0);
  2439   p->size = nbits;
  2440 
  2441   /* Clear padding at the end.  */
  2442   if (words)
  2443     p->data[words - 1] = 0;
  2444 
  2445   return val;
  2446 }
  2447 
  2448 DEFUN ("make-bool-vector", Fmake_bool_vector, Smake_bool_vector, 2, 2, 0,
  2449        doc: /* Return a new bool-vector of length LENGTH, using INIT for each element.
  2450 LENGTH must be a number.  INIT matters only in whether it is t or nil.  */)
  2451   (Lisp_Object length, Lisp_Object init)
  2452 {
  2453   Lisp_Object val;
  2454 
  2455   CHECK_FIXNAT (length);
  2456   val = make_uninit_bool_vector (XFIXNAT (length));
  2457   return bool_vector_fill (val, init);
  2458 }
  2459 
  2460 DEFUN ("bool-vector", Fbool_vector, Sbool_vector, 0, MANY, 0,
  2461        doc: /* Return a new bool-vector with specified arguments as elements.
  2462 Allows any number of arguments, including zero.
  2463 usage: (bool-vector &rest OBJECTS)  */)
  2464   (ptrdiff_t nargs, Lisp_Object *args)
  2465 {
  2466   ptrdiff_t i;
  2467   Lisp_Object vector;
  2468 
  2469   vector = make_uninit_bool_vector (nargs);
  2470   for (i = 0; i < nargs; i++)
  2471     bool_vector_set (vector, i, !NILP (args[i]));
  2472 
  2473   return vector;
  2474 }
  2475 
  2476 /* Make a string from NBYTES bytes at CONTENTS, and compute the number
  2477    of characters from the contents.  This string may be unibyte or
  2478    multibyte, depending on the contents.  */
  2479 
  2480 Lisp_Object
  2481 make_string (const char *contents, ptrdiff_t nbytes)
  2482 {
  2483   register Lisp_Object val;
  2484   ptrdiff_t nchars, multibyte_nbytes;
  2485 
  2486   parse_str_as_multibyte ((const unsigned char *) contents, nbytes,
  2487                           &nchars, &multibyte_nbytes);
  2488   if (nbytes == nchars || nbytes != multibyte_nbytes)
  2489     /* CONTENTS contains no multibyte sequences or contains an invalid
  2490        multibyte sequence.  We must make unibyte string.  */
  2491     val = make_unibyte_string (contents, nbytes);
  2492   else
  2493     val = make_multibyte_string (contents, nchars, nbytes);
  2494   return val;
  2495 }
  2496 
  2497 /* Make a unibyte string from LENGTH bytes at CONTENTS.  */
  2498 
  2499 Lisp_Object
  2500 make_unibyte_string (const char *contents, ptrdiff_t length)
  2501 {
  2502   register Lisp_Object val;
  2503   val = make_uninit_string (length);
  2504   memcpy (SDATA (val), contents, length);
  2505   return val;
  2506 }
  2507 
  2508 
  2509 /* Make a multibyte string from NCHARS characters occupying NBYTES
  2510    bytes at CONTENTS.  */
  2511 
  2512 Lisp_Object
  2513 make_multibyte_string (const char *contents,
  2514                        ptrdiff_t nchars, ptrdiff_t nbytes)
  2515 {
  2516   register Lisp_Object val;
  2517   val = make_uninit_multibyte_string (nchars, nbytes);
  2518   memcpy (SDATA (val), contents, nbytes);
  2519   return val;
  2520 }
  2521 
  2522 
  2523 /* Make a string from NCHARS characters occupying NBYTES bytes at
  2524    CONTENTS.  It is a multibyte string if NBYTES != NCHARS.  */
  2525 
  2526 Lisp_Object
  2527 make_string_from_bytes (const char *contents,
  2528                         ptrdiff_t nchars, ptrdiff_t nbytes)
  2529 {
  2530   register Lisp_Object val;
  2531   val = make_uninit_multibyte_string (nchars, nbytes);
  2532   memcpy (SDATA (val), contents, nbytes);
  2533   if (SBYTES (val) == SCHARS (val))
  2534     STRING_SET_UNIBYTE (val);
  2535   return val;
  2536 }
  2537 
  2538 
  2539 /* Make a string from NCHARS characters occupying NBYTES bytes at
  2540    CONTENTS.  The argument MULTIBYTE controls whether to label the
  2541    string as multibyte.  If NCHARS is negative, it counts the number of
  2542    characters by itself.  */
  2543 
  2544 Lisp_Object
  2545 make_specified_string (const char *contents,
  2546                        ptrdiff_t nchars, ptrdiff_t nbytes, bool multibyte)
  2547 {
  2548   Lisp_Object val;
  2549 
  2550   if (nchars < 0)
  2551     {
  2552       if (multibyte)
  2553         nchars = multibyte_chars_in_text ((const unsigned char *) contents,
  2554                                           nbytes);
  2555       else
  2556         nchars = nbytes;
  2557     }
  2558   val = make_uninit_multibyte_string (nchars, nbytes);
  2559   memcpy (SDATA (val), contents, nbytes);
  2560   if (!multibyte)
  2561     STRING_SET_UNIBYTE (val);
  2562   return val;
  2563 }
  2564 
  2565 
  2566 /* Return a unibyte Lisp_String set up to hold LENGTH characters
  2567    occupying LENGTH bytes.  If CLEARIT, clear its contents to null
  2568    bytes; otherwise, the contents are uninitialized.  */
  2569 
  2570 static Lisp_Object
  2571 make_clear_string (EMACS_INT length, bool clearit)
  2572 {
  2573   Lisp_Object val;
  2574 
  2575   if (!length)
  2576     return empty_unibyte_string;
  2577   val = make_clear_multibyte_string (length, length, clearit);
  2578   STRING_SET_UNIBYTE (val);
  2579   return val;
  2580 }
  2581 
  2582 /* Return a unibyte Lisp_String set up to hold LENGTH characters
  2583    occupying LENGTH bytes.  */
  2584 
  2585 Lisp_Object
  2586 make_uninit_string (EMACS_INT length)
  2587 {
  2588   return make_clear_string (length, false);
  2589 }
  2590 
  2591 
  2592 /* Return a multibyte Lisp_String set up to hold NCHARS characters
  2593    which occupy NBYTES bytes.  If CLEARIT, clear its contents to null
  2594    bytes; otherwise, the contents are uninitialized.  */
  2595 
  2596 static Lisp_Object
  2597 make_clear_multibyte_string (EMACS_INT nchars, EMACS_INT nbytes, bool clearit)
  2598 {
  2599   Lisp_Object string;
  2600   struct Lisp_String *s;
  2601 
  2602   if (nchars < 0)
  2603     emacs_abort ();
  2604   if (!nbytes)
  2605     return empty_multibyte_string;
  2606 
  2607   s = allocate_string ();
  2608   s->u.s.intervals = NULL;
  2609   allocate_string_data (s, nchars, nbytes, clearit, false);
  2610   XSETSTRING (string, s);
  2611   string_chars_consed += nbytes;
  2612   return string;
  2613 }
  2614 
  2615 /* Return a multibyte Lisp_String set up to hold NCHARS characters
  2616    which occupy NBYTES bytes.  */
  2617 
  2618 Lisp_Object
  2619 make_uninit_multibyte_string (EMACS_INT nchars, EMACS_INT nbytes)
  2620 {
  2621   return make_clear_multibyte_string (nchars, nbytes, false);
  2622 }
  2623 
  2624 /* Print arguments to BUF according to a FORMAT, then return
  2625    a Lisp_String initialized with the data from BUF.  */
  2626 
  2627 Lisp_Object
  2628 make_formatted_string (char *buf, const char *format, ...)
  2629 {
  2630   va_list ap;
  2631   int length;
  2632 
  2633   va_start (ap, format);
  2634   length = vsprintf (buf, format, ap);
  2635   va_end (ap);
  2636   return make_string (buf, length);
  2637 }
  2638 
  2639 /* Pin a unibyte string in place so that it won't move during GC.  */
  2640 void
  2641 pin_string (Lisp_Object string)
  2642 {
  2643   eassert (STRINGP (string) && !STRING_MULTIBYTE (string));
  2644   struct Lisp_String *s = XSTRING (string);
  2645   ptrdiff_t size = STRING_BYTES (s);
  2646   unsigned char *data = s->u.s.data;
  2647 
  2648   if (!(size > LARGE_STRING_BYTES
  2649         || PURE_P (data) || pdumper_object_p (data)
  2650         || s->u.s.size_byte == -3))
  2651     {
  2652       eassert (s->u.s.size_byte == -1);
  2653       sdata *old_sdata = SDATA_OF_STRING (s);
  2654       allocate_string_data (s, size, size, false, true);
  2655       memcpy (s->u.s.data, data, size);
  2656       old_sdata->string = NULL;
  2657       SDATA_NBYTES (old_sdata) = size;
  2658       ASAN_PREPARE_DEAD_SDATA (old_sdata, size);
  2659     }
  2660   s->u.s.size_byte = -3;
  2661 }
  2662 
  2663 
  2664 /***********************************************************************
  2665                            Float Allocation
  2666  ***********************************************************************/
  2667 
  2668 /* We store float cells inside of float_blocks, allocating a new
  2669    float_block with malloc whenever necessary.  Float cells reclaimed
  2670    by GC are put on a free list to be reallocated before allocating
  2671    any new float cells from the latest float_block.  */
  2672 
  2673 #define FLOAT_BLOCK_SIZE                                        \
  2674   (((BLOCK_BYTES - sizeof (struct float_block *)                \
  2675      /* The compiler might add padding at the end.  */          \
  2676      - (sizeof (struct Lisp_Float) - sizeof (bits_word))) * CHAR_BIT) \
  2677    / (sizeof (struct Lisp_Float) * CHAR_BIT + 1))
  2678 
  2679 #define GETMARKBIT(block,n)                             \
  2680   (((block)->gcmarkbits[(n) / BITS_PER_BITS_WORD]       \
  2681     >> ((n) % BITS_PER_BITS_WORD))                      \
  2682    & 1)
  2683 
  2684 #define SETMARKBIT(block,n)                             \
  2685   ((block)->gcmarkbits[(n) / BITS_PER_BITS_WORD]        \
  2686    |= (bits_word) 1 << ((n) % BITS_PER_BITS_WORD))
  2687 
  2688 #define UNSETMARKBIT(block,n)                           \
  2689   ((block)->gcmarkbits[(n) / BITS_PER_BITS_WORD]        \
  2690    &= ~((bits_word) 1 << ((n) % BITS_PER_BITS_WORD)))
  2691 
  2692 #define FLOAT_BLOCK(fptr) \
  2693   (eassert (!pdumper_object_p (fptr)),                                  \
  2694    ((struct float_block *) (((uintptr_t) (fptr)) & ~(BLOCK_ALIGN - 1))))
  2695 
  2696 #define FLOAT_INDEX(fptr) \
  2697   ((((uintptr_t) (fptr)) & (BLOCK_ALIGN - 1)) / sizeof (struct Lisp_Float))
  2698 
  2699 struct float_block
  2700 {
  2701   /* Place `floats' at the beginning, to ease up FLOAT_INDEX's job.  */
  2702   struct Lisp_Float floats[FLOAT_BLOCK_SIZE];
  2703   bits_word gcmarkbits[1 + FLOAT_BLOCK_SIZE / BITS_PER_BITS_WORD];
  2704   struct float_block *next;
  2705 };
  2706 
  2707 #define XFLOAT_MARKED_P(fptr) \
  2708   GETMARKBIT (FLOAT_BLOCK (fptr), FLOAT_INDEX ((fptr)))
  2709 
  2710 #define XFLOAT_MARK(fptr) \
  2711   SETMARKBIT (FLOAT_BLOCK (fptr), FLOAT_INDEX ((fptr)))
  2712 
  2713 #define XFLOAT_UNMARK(fptr) \
  2714   UNSETMARKBIT (FLOAT_BLOCK (fptr), FLOAT_INDEX ((fptr)))
  2715 
  2716 #if GC_ASAN_POISON_OBJECTS
  2717 # define ASAN_POISON_FLOAT_BLOCK(fblk)         \
  2718   __asan_poison_memory_region ((fblk)->floats, \
  2719                                sizeof ((fblk)->floats))
  2720 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_FLOAT_BLOCK(fblk)         \
  2721   __asan_unpoison_memory_region ((fblk)->floats, \
  2722                                  sizeof ((fblk)->floats))
  2723 # define ASAN_POISON_FLOAT(p) \
  2724   __asan_poison_memory_region ((p), sizeof (struct Lisp_Float))
  2725 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_FLOAT(p) \
  2726   __asan_unpoison_memory_region ((p), sizeof (struct Lisp_Float))
  2727 #else
  2728 # define ASAN_POISON_FLOAT_BLOCK(fblk) ((void) 0)
  2729 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_FLOAT_BLOCK(fblk) ((void) 0)
  2730 # define ASAN_POISON_FLOAT(p) ((void) 0)
  2731 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_FLOAT(p) ((void) 0)
  2732 #endif
  2733 
  2734 /* Current float_block.  */
  2735 
  2736 static struct float_block *float_block;
  2737 
  2738 /* Index of first unused Lisp_Float in the current float_block.  */
  2739 
  2740 static int float_block_index = FLOAT_BLOCK_SIZE;
  2741 
  2742 /* Free-list of Lisp_Floats.  */
  2743 
  2744 static struct Lisp_Float *float_free_list;
  2745 
  2746 /* Return a new float object with value FLOAT_VALUE.  */
  2747 
  2748 Lisp_Object
  2749 make_float (double float_value)
  2750 {
  2751   register Lisp_Object val;
  2752 
  2753   MALLOC_BLOCK_INPUT;
  2754 
  2755   if (float_free_list)
  2756     {
  2757       XSETFLOAT (val, float_free_list);
  2758       ASAN_UNPOISON_FLOAT (float_free_list);
  2759       float_free_list = float_free_list->u.chain;
  2760     }
  2761   else
  2762     {
  2763       if (float_block_index == FLOAT_BLOCK_SIZE)
  2764         {
  2765           struct float_block *new
  2766             = lisp_align_malloc (sizeof *new, MEM_TYPE_FLOAT);
  2767           new->next = float_block;
  2768           memset (new->gcmarkbits, 0, sizeof new->gcmarkbits);
  2769           ASAN_POISON_FLOAT_BLOCK (new);
  2770           float_block = new;
  2771           float_block_index = 0;
  2772         }
  2773       ASAN_UNPOISON_FLOAT (&float_block->floats[float_block_index]);
  2774       XSETFLOAT (val, &float_block->floats[float_block_index]);
  2775       float_block_index++;
  2776     }
  2777 
  2778   MALLOC_UNBLOCK_INPUT;
  2779 
  2780   XFLOAT_INIT (val, float_value);
  2781   eassert (!XFLOAT_MARKED_P (XFLOAT (val)));
  2782   tally_consing (sizeof (struct Lisp_Float));
  2783   floats_consed++;
  2784   return val;
  2785 }
  2786 
  2787 
  2788 
  2789 /***********************************************************************
  2790                            Cons Allocation
  2791  ***********************************************************************/
  2792 
  2793 /* We store cons cells inside of cons_blocks, allocating a new
  2794    cons_block with malloc whenever necessary.  Cons cells reclaimed by
  2795    GC are put on a free list to be reallocated before allocating
  2796    any new cons cells from the latest cons_block.  */
  2797 
  2798 #define CONS_BLOCK_SIZE                                         \
  2799   (((BLOCK_BYTES - sizeof (struct cons_block *)                 \
  2800      /* The compiler might add padding at the end.  */          \
  2801      - (sizeof (struct Lisp_Cons) - sizeof (bits_word))) * CHAR_BIT)    \
  2802    / (sizeof (struct Lisp_Cons) * CHAR_BIT + 1))
  2803 
  2804 #define CONS_BLOCK(fptr) \
  2805   (eassert (!pdumper_object_p (fptr)),                                  \
  2806    ((struct cons_block *) ((uintptr_t) (fptr) & ~(BLOCK_ALIGN - 1))))
  2807 
  2808 #define CONS_INDEX(fptr) \
  2809   (((uintptr_t) (fptr) & (BLOCK_ALIGN - 1)) / sizeof (struct Lisp_Cons))
  2810 
  2811 struct cons_block
  2812 {
  2813   /* Place `conses' at the beginning, to ease up CONS_INDEX's job.  */
  2814   struct Lisp_Cons conses[CONS_BLOCK_SIZE];
  2815   bits_word gcmarkbits[1 + CONS_BLOCK_SIZE / BITS_PER_BITS_WORD];
  2816   struct cons_block *next;
  2817 };
  2818 
  2819 #define XCONS_MARKED_P(fptr) \
  2820   GETMARKBIT (CONS_BLOCK (fptr), CONS_INDEX ((fptr)))
  2821 
  2822 #define XMARK_CONS(fptr) \
  2823   SETMARKBIT (CONS_BLOCK (fptr), CONS_INDEX ((fptr)))
  2824 
  2825 #define XUNMARK_CONS(fptr) \
  2826   UNSETMARKBIT (CONS_BLOCK (fptr), CONS_INDEX ((fptr)))
  2827 
  2828 /* Minimum number of bytes of consing since GC before next GC,
  2829    when memory is full.  */
  2830 
  2831 enum { memory_full_cons_threshold = sizeof (struct cons_block) };
  2832 
  2833 /* Current cons_block.  */
  2834 
  2835 static struct cons_block *cons_block;
  2836 
  2837 /* Index of first unused Lisp_Cons in the current block.  */
  2838 
  2839 static int cons_block_index = CONS_BLOCK_SIZE;
  2840 
  2841 /* Free-list of Lisp_Cons structures.  */
  2842 
  2843 static struct Lisp_Cons *cons_free_list;
  2844 
  2845 #if GC_ASAN_POISON_OBJECTS
  2846 # define ASAN_POISON_CONS_BLOCK(b) \
  2847   __asan_poison_memory_region ((b)->conses, sizeof ((b)->conses))
  2848 # define ASAN_POISON_CONS(p) \
  2849   __asan_poison_memory_region ((p), sizeof (struct Lisp_Cons))
  2850 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_CONS(p) \
  2851   __asan_unpoison_memory_region ((p), sizeof (struct Lisp_Cons))
  2852 #else
  2853 # define ASAN_POISON_CONS_BLOCK(b) ((void) 0)
  2854 # define ASAN_POISON_CONS(p) ((void) 0)
  2855 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_CONS(p) ((void) 0)
  2856 #endif
  2857 
  2858 /* Explicitly free a cons cell by putting it on the free-list.  */
  2859 
  2860 void
  2861 free_cons (struct Lisp_Cons *ptr)
  2862 {
  2863   ptr->u.s.u.chain = cons_free_list;
  2864   ptr->u.s.car = dead_object ();
  2865   cons_free_list = ptr;
  2866   ptrdiff_t nbytes = sizeof *ptr;
  2867   tally_consing (-nbytes);
  2868   ASAN_POISON_CONS (ptr);
  2869 }
  2870 
  2871 DEFUN ("cons", Fcons, Scons, 2, 2, 0,
  2872        doc: /* Create a new cons, give it CAR and CDR as components, and return it.  */)
  2873   (Lisp_Object car, Lisp_Object cdr)
  2874 {
  2875   register Lisp_Object val;
  2876 
  2877   MALLOC_BLOCK_INPUT;
  2878 
  2879   if (cons_free_list)
  2880     {
  2881       ASAN_UNPOISON_CONS (cons_free_list);
  2882       XSETCONS (val, cons_free_list);
  2883       cons_free_list = cons_free_list->u.s.u.chain;
  2884     }
  2885   else
  2886     {
  2887       if (cons_block_index == CONS_BLOCK_SIZE)
  2888         {
  2889           struct cons_block *new
  2890             = lisp_align_malloc (sizeof *new, MEM_TYPE_CONS);
  2891           memset (new->gcmarkbits, 0, sizeof new->gcmarkbits);
  2892           ASAN_POISON_CONS_BLOCK (new);
  2893           new->next = cons_block;
  2894           cons_block = new;
  2895           cons_block_index = 0;
  2896         }
  2897       ASAN_UNPOISON_CONS (&cons_block->conses[cons_block_index]);
  2898       XSETCONS (val, &cons_block->conses[cons_block_index]);
  2899       cons_block_index++;
  2900     }
  2901 
  2902   MALLOC_UNBLOCK_INPUT;
  2903 
  2904   XSETCAR (val, car);
  2905   XSETCDR (val, cdr);
  2906   eassert (!XCONS_MARKED_P (XCONS (val)));
  2907   consing_until_gc -= sizeof (struct Lisp_Cons);
  2908   cons_cells_consed++;
  2909   return val;
  2910 }
  2911 
  2912 /* Make a list of 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5 specified objects.  */
  2913 
  2914 Lisp_Object
  2915 list1 (Lisp_Object arg1)
  2916 {
  2917   return Fcons (arg1, Qnil);
  2918 }
  2919 
  2920 Lisp_Object
  2921 list2 (Lisp_Object arg1, Lisp_Object arg2)
  2922 {
  2923   return Fcons (arg1, Fcons (arg2, Qnil));
  2924 }
  2925 
  2926 
  2927 Lisp_Object
  2928 list3 (Lisp_Object arg1, Lisp_Object arg2, Lisp_Object arg3)
  2929 {
  2930   return Fcons (arg1, Fcons (arg2, Fcons (arg3, Qnil)));
  2931 }
  2932 
  2933 Lisp_Object
  2934 list4 (Lisp_Object arg1, Lisp_Object arg2, Lisp_Object arg3, Lisp_Object arg4)
  2935 {
  2936   return Fcons (arg1, Fcons (arg2, Fcons (arg3, Fcons (arg4, Qnil))));
  2937 }
  2938 
  2939 Lisp_Object
  2940 list5 (Lisp_Object arg1, Lisp_Object arg2, Lisp_Object arg3, Lisp_Object arg4,
  2941        Lisp_Object arg5)
  2942 {
  2943   return Fcons (arg1, Fcons (arg2, Fcons (arg3, Fcons (arg4,
  2944                                                        Fcons (arg5, Qnil)))));
  2945 }
  2946 
  2947 /* Make a list of COUNT Lisp_Objects, where ARG is the first one.
  2948    Use CONS to construct the pairs.  AP has any remaining args.  */
  2949 static Lisp_Object
  2950 cons_listn (ptrdiff_t count, Lisp_Object arg,
  2951             Lisp_Object (*cons) (Lisp_Object, Lisp_Object), va_list ap)
  2952 {
  2953   eassume (0 < count);
  2954   Lisp_Object val = cons (arg, Qnil);
  2955   Lisp_Object tail = val;
  2956   for (ptrdiff_t i = 1; i < count; i++)
  2957     {
  2958       Lisp_Object elem = cons (va_arg (ap, Lisp_Object), Qnil);
  2959       XSETCDR (tail, elem);
  2960       tail = elem;
  2961     }
  2962   return val;
  2963 }
  2964 
  2965 /* Make a list of COUNT Lisp_Objects, where ARG1 is the first one.  */
  2966 Lisp_Object
  2967 listn (ptrdiff_t count, Lisp_Object arg1, ...)
  2968 {
  2969   va_list ap;
  2970   va_start (ap, arg1);
  2971   Lisp_Object val = cons_listn (count, arg1, Fcons, ap);
  2972   va_end (ap);
  2973   return val;
  2974 }
  2975 
  2976 /* Make a pure list of COUNT Lisp_Objects, where ARG1 is the first one.  */
  2977 Lisp_Object
  2978 pure_listn (ptrdiff_t count, Lisp_Object arg1, ...)
  2979 {
  2980   va_list ap;
  2981   va_start (ap, arg1);
  2982   Lisp_Object val = cons_listn (count, arg1, pure_cons, ap);
  2983   va_end (ap);
  2984   return val;
  2985 }
  2986 
  2987 DEFUN ("list", Flist, Slist, 0, MANY, 0,
  2988        doc: /* Return a newly created list with specified arguments as elements.
  2989 Allows any number of arguments, including zero.
  2990 usage: (list &rest OBJECTS)  */)
  2991   (ptrdiff_t nargs, Lisp_Object *args)
  2992 {
  2993   register Lisp_Object val;
  2994   val = Qnil;
  2995 
  2996   while (nargs > 0)
  2997     {
  2998       nargs--;
  2999       val = Fcons (args[nargs], val);
  3000     }
  3001   return val;
  3002 }
  3003 
  3004 
  3005 DEFUN ("make-list", Fmake_list, Smake_list, 2, 2, 0,
  3006        doc: /* Return a newly created list of length LENGTH, with each element being INIT.  */)
  3007   (Lisp_Object length, Lisp_Object init)
  3008 {
  3009   Lisp_Object val = Qnil;
  3010   CHECK_FIXNAT (length);
  3011 
  3012   for (EMACS_INT size = XFIXNAT (length); 0 < size; size--)
  3013     {
  3014       val = Fcons (init, val);
  3015       rarely_quit (size);
  3016     }
  3017 
  3018   return val;
  3019 }
  3020 
  3021 
  3022 
  3023 /***********************************************************************
  3024                            Vector Allocation
  3025  ***********************************************************************/
  3026 
  3027 /* Sometimes a vector's contents are merely a pointer internally used
  3028    in vector allocation code.  On the rare platforms where a null
  3029    pointer cannot be tagged, represent it with a Lisp 0.
  3030    Usually you don't want to touch this.  */
  3031 
  3032 static struct Lisp_Vector *
  3033 next_vector (struct Lisp_Vector *v)
  3034 {
  3035   return XUNTAG (v->contents[0], Lisp_Int0, struct Lisp_Vector);
  3036 }
  3037 
  3038 static void
  3039 set_next_vector (struct Lisp_Vector *v, struct Lisp_Vector *p)
  3040 {
  3041   v->contents[0] = make_lisp_ptr (p, Lisp_Int0);
  3042 }
  3043 
  3044 /* This value is balanced well enough to avoid too much internal overhead
  3045    for the most common cases; it's not required to be a power of two, but
  3046    it's expected to be a mult-of-ROUNDUP_SIZE (see below).  */
  3047 
  3048 enum { VECTOR_BLOCK_SIZE = 4096 };
  3049 
  3050 /* Vector size requests are a multiple of this.  */
  3051 enum { roundup_size = COMMON_MULTIPLE (LISP_ALIGNMENT, word_size) };
  3052 
  3053 /* Verify assumptions described above.  */
  3054 verify (VECTOR_BLOCK_SIZE % roundup_size == 0);
  3055 verify (VECTOR_BLOCK_SIZE <= (1 << PSEUDOVECTOR_SIZE_BITS));
  3056 
  3057 /* Round up X to nearest mult-of-ROUNDUP_SIZE --- use at compile time.  */
  3058 #define vroundup_ct(x) ROUNDUP (x, roundup_size)
  3059 /* Round up X to nearest mult-of-ROUNDUP_SIZE --- use at runtime.  */
  3060 #define vroundup(x) (eassume ((x) >= 0), vroundup_ct (x))
  3061 
  3062 /* Rounding helps to maintain alignment constraints if USE_LSB_TAG.  */
  3063 
  3064 enum {VECTOR_BLOCK_BYTES = VECTOR_BLOCK_SIZE - vroundup_ct (sizeof (void *))};
  3065 
  3066 /* Size of the minimal vector allocated from block.  */
  3067 
  3068 enum { VBLOCK_BYTES_MIN = vroundup_ct (header_size + sizeof (Lisp_Object)) };
  3069 
  3070 /* Size of the largest vector allocated from block.  */
  3071 
  3072 enum { VBLOCK_BYTES_MAX = vroundup_ct ((VECTOR_BLOCK_BYTES / 2) - word_size) };
  3073 
  3074 /* We maintain one free list for each possible block-allocated
  3075    vector size, and this is the number of free lists we have.  */
  3076 
  3077 enum { VECTOR_MAX_FREE_LIST_INDEX =
  3078        (VECTOR_BLOCK_BYTES - VBLOCK_BYTES_MIN) / roundup_size + 1 };
  3079 
  3080 /* Common shortcut to advance vector pointer over a block data.  */
  3081 
  3082 static struct Lisp_Vector *
  3083 ADVANCE (struct Lisp_Vector *v, ptrdiff_t nbytes)
  3084 {
  3085   void *vv = v;
  3086   char *cv = vv;
  3087   void *p = cv + nbytes;
  3088   return p;
  3089 }
  3090 
  3091 /* Common shortcut to calculate NBYTES-vector index in VECTOR_FREE_LISTS.  */
  3092 
  3093 static ptrdiff_t
  3094 VINDEX (ptrdiff_t nbytes)
  3095 {
  3096   eassume (VBLOCK_BYTES_MIN <= nbytes);
  3097   return (nbytes - VBLOCK_BYTES_MIN) / roundup_size;
  3098 }
  3099 
  3100 /* This internal type is used to maintain the list of large vectors
  3101    which are allocated at their own, e.g. outside of vector blocks.
  3102 
  3103    struct large_vector itself cannot contain a struct Lisp_Vector, as
  3104    the latter contains a flexible array member and C99 does not allow
  3105    such structs to be nested.  Instead, each struct large_vector
  3106    object LV is followed by a struct Lisp_Vector, which is at offset
  3107    large_vector_offset from LV, and whose address is therefore
  3108    large_vector_vec (&LV).  */
  3109 
  3110 struct large_vector
  3111 {
  3112   struct large_vector *next;
  3113 };
  3114 
  3115 enum
  3116 {
  3117   large_vector_offset = ROUNDUP (sizeof (struct large_vector), LISP_ALIGNMENT)
  3118 };
  3119 
  3120 static struct Lisp_Vector *
  3121 large_vector_vec (struct large_vector *p)
  3122 {
  3123   return (struct Lisp_Vector *) ((char *) p + large_vector_offset);
  3124 }
  3125 
  3126 /* This internal type is used to maintain an underlying storage
  3127    for small vectors.  */
  3128 
  3129 struct vector_block
  3130 {
  3131   char data[VECTOR_BLOCK_BYTES];
  3132   struct vector_block *next;
  3133 };
  3134 
  3135 /* Chain of vector blocks.  */
  3136 
  3137 static struct vector_block *vector_blocks;
  3138 
  3139 /* Vector free lists, where NTH item points to a chain of free
  3140    vectors of the same NBYTES size, so NTH == VINDEX (NBYTES).  */
  3141 
  3142 static struct Lisp_Vector *vector_free_lists[VECTOR_MAX_FREE_LIST_INDEX];
  3143 
  3144 /* Singly-linked list of large vectors.  */
  3145 
  3146 static struct large_vector *large_vectors;
  3147 
  3148 /* The only vector with 0 slots, allocated from pure space.  */
  3149 
  3150 Lisp_Object zero_vector;
  3151 
  3152 #if GC_ASAN_POISON_OBJECTS
  3153 # define ASAN_POISON_VECTOR_CONTENTS(v, bytes) \
  3154   __asan_poison_memory_region ((v)->contents, (bytes))
  3155 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_VECTOR_CONTENTS(v, bytes) \
  3156   __asan_unpoison_memory_region ((v)->contents, (bytes))
  3157 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_VECTOR_BLOCK(b) \
  3158   __asan_unpoison_memory_region ((b)->data, sizeof ((b)->data))
  3159 #else
  3160 # define ASAN_POISON_VECTOR_CONTENTS(v, bytes) ((void) 0)
  3161 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_VECTOR_CONTENTS(v, bytes) ((void) 0)
  3162 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_VECTOR_BLOCK(b) ((void) 0)
  3163 #endif
  3164 
  3165 /* Common shortcut to setup vector on a free list.  */
  3166 
  3167 static void
  3168 setup_on_free_list (struct Lisp_Vector *v, ptrdiff_t nbytes)
  3169 {
  3170   eassume (header_size <= nbytes);
  3171   ptrdiff_t nwords = (nbytes - header_size) / word_size;
  3172   XSETPVECTYPESIZE (v, PVEC_FREE, 0, nwords);
  3173   eassert (nbytes % roundup_size == 0);
  3174   ptrdiff_t vindex = VINDEX (nbytes);
  3175   eassert (vindex < VECTOR_MAX_FREE_LIST_INDEX);
  3176   set_next_vector (v, vector_free_lists[vindex]);
  3177   ASAN_POISON_VECTOR_CONTENTS (v, nbytes - header_size);
  3178   vector_free_lists[vindex] = v;
  3179 }
  3180 
  3181 /* Get a new vector block.  */
  3182 
  3183 static struct vector_block *
  3184 allocate_vector_block (void)
  3185 {
  3186   struct vector_block *block = xmalloc (sizeof *block);
  3187 
  3188 #ifndef GC_MALLOC_CHECK
  3189   mem_insert (block->data, block->data + VECTOR_BLOCK_BYTES,
  3190               MEM_TYPE_VECTOR_BLOCK);
  3191 #endif
  3192 
  3193   block->next = vector_blocks;
  3194   vector_blocks = block;
  3195   return block;
  3196 }
  3197 
  3198 /* Called once to initialize vector allocation.  */
  3199 
  3200 static void
  3201 init_vectors (void)
  3202 {
  3203   zero_vector = make_pure_vector (0);
  3204   staticpro (&zero_vector);
  3205 }
  3206 
  3207 /* Allocate vector from a vector block.  */
  3208 
  3209 static struct Lisp_Vector *
  3210 allocate_vector_from_block (ptrdiff_t nbytes)
  3211 {
  3212   struct Lisp_Vector *vector;
  3213   struct vector_block *block;
  3214   size_t index, restbytes;
  3215 
  3216   eassume (VBLOCK_BYTES_MIN <= nbytes && nbytes <= VBLOCK_BYTES_MAX);
  3217   eassume (nbytes % roundup_size == 0);
  3218 
  3219   /* First, try to allocate from a free list
  3220      containing vectors of the requested size.  */
  3221   index = VINDEX (nbytes);
  3222   if (vector_free_lists[index])
  3223     {
  3224       vector = vector_free_lists[index];
  3225       ASAN_UNPOISON_VECTOR_CONTENTS (vector, nbytes - header_size);
  3226       vector_free_lists[index] = next_vector (vector);
  3227       return vector;
  3228     }
  3229 
  3230   /* Next, check free lists containing larger vectors.  Since
  3231      we will split the result, we should have remaining space
  3232      large enough to use for one-slot vector at least.  */
  3233   for (index = VINDEX (nbytes + VBLOCK_BYTES_MIN);
  3234        index < VECTOR_MAX_FREE_LIST_INDEX; index++)
  3235     if (vector_free_lists[index])
  3236       {
  3237         /* This vector is larger than requested.  */
  3238         vector = vector_free_lists[index];
  3239         ASAN_UNPOISON_VECTOR_CONTENTS (vector, nbytes - header_size);
  3240         vector_free_lists[index] = next_vector (vector);
  3241 
  3242         /* Excess bytes are used for the smaller vector,
  3243            which should be set on an appropriate free list.  */
  3244         restbytes = index * roundup_size + VBLOCK_BYTES_MIN - nbytes;
  3245         eassert (restbytes % roundup_size == 0);
  3246 #if GC_ASAN_POISON_OBJECTS
  3247         /* Ensure that accessing excess bytes does not trigger ASan.  */
  3248         __asan_unpoison_memory_region (ADVANCE (vector, nbytes),
  3249                                        restbytes);
  3250 #endif
  3251         setup_on_free_list (ADVANCE (vector, nbytes), restbytes);
  3252         return vector;
  3253       }
  3254 
  3255   /* Finally, need a new vector block.  */
  3256   block = allocate_vector_block ();
  3257 
  3258   /* New vector will be at the beginning of this block.  */
  3259   vector = (struct Lisp_Vector *) block->data;
  3260 
  3261   /* If the rest of space from this block is large enough
  3262      for one-slot vector at least, set up it on a free list.  */
  3263   restbytes = VECTOR_BLOCK_BYTES - nbytes;
  3264   if (restbytes >= VBLOCK_BYTES_MIN)
  3265     {
  3266       eassert (restbytes % roundup_size == 0);
  3267       setup_on_free_list (ADVANCE (vector, nbytes), restbytes);
  3268     }
  3269   return vector;
  3270 }
  3271 
  3272 /* Nonzero if VECTOR pointer is valid pointer inside BLOCK.  */
  3273 
  3274 #define VECTOR_IN_BLOCK(vector, block)          \
  3275   ((char *) (vector) <= (block)->data           \
  3276    + VECTOR_BLOCK_BYTES - VBLOCK_BYTES_MIN)
  3277 
  3278 /* Return the memory footprint of V in bytes.  */
  3279 
  3280 ptrdiff_t
  3281 vectorlike_nbytes (const union vectorlike_header *hdr)
  3282 {
  3283   ptrdiff_t size = hdr->size & ~ARRAY_MARK_FLAG;
  3284   ptrdiff_t nwords;
  3285 
  3286   if (size & PSEUDOVECTOR_FLAG)
  3287     {
  3288       if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (hdr, PVEC_BOOL_VECTOR))
  3289         {
  3290           struct Lisp_Bool_Vector *bv = (struct Lisp_Bool_Vector *) hdr;
  3291           ptrdiff_t word_bytes = (bool_vector_words (bv->size)
  3292                                   * sizeof (bits_word));
  3293           ptrdiff_t boolvec_bytes = bool_header_size + word_bytes;
  3294           verify (header_size <= bool_header_size);
  3295           nwords = (boolvec_bytes - header_size + word_size - 1) / word_size;
  3296         }
  3297       else
  3298         nwords = ((size & PSEUDOVECTOR_SIZE_MASK)
  3299                   + ((size & PSEUDOVECTOR_REST_MASK)
  3300                      >> PSEUDOVECTOR_SIZE_BITS));
  3301     }
  3302   else
  3303     nwords = size;
  3304   return vroundup (header_size + word_size * nwords);
  3305 }
  3306 
  3307 /* Convert a pseudovector pointer P to its underlying struct T pointer.
  3308    Verify that the struct is small, since cleanup_vector is called
  3309    only on small vector-like objects.  */
  3310 
  3311 #define PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT(p, t) \
  3312   verify_expr ((header_size + VECSIZE (struct t) * word_size \
  3313                 <= VBLOCK_BYTES_MAX), \
  3314                (struct t *) (p))
  3315 
  3316 /* Release extra resources still in use by VECTOR, which may be any
  3317    small vector-like object.  */
  3318 
  3319 static void
  3320 cleanup_vector (struct Lisp_Vector *vector)
  3321 {
  3322   detect_suspicious_free (vector);
  3323 
  3324   if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_BIGNUM))
  3325     mpz_clear (PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, Lisp_Bignum)->value);
  3326   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_OVERLAY))
  3327     {
  3328       struct Lisp_Overlay *ol = PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, Lisp_Overlay);
  3329       xfree (ol->interval);
  3330     }
  3331   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_FINALIZER))
  3332     unchain_finalizer (PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, Lisp_Finalizer));
  3333   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_FONT))
  3334     {
  3335       if ((vector->header.size & PSEUDOVECTOR_SIZE_MASK) == FONT_OBJECT_MAX)
  3336         {
  3337           struct font *font = PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, font);
  3338           struct font_driver const *drv = font->driver;
  3339 
  3340           /* The font driver might sometimes be NULL, e.g. if Emacs was
  3341              interrupted before it had time to set it up.  */
  3342           if (drv)
  3343             {
  3344               /* Attempt to catch subtle bugs like Bug#16140.  */
  3345               eassert (valid_font_driver (drv));
  3346               drv->close_font (font);
  3347             }
  3348         }
  3349     }
  3350   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_THREAD))
  3351     finalize_one_thread (PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, thread_state));
  3352   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_MUTEX))
  3353     finalize_one_mutex (PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, Lisp_Mutex));
  3354   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_CONDVAR))
  3355     finalize_one_condvar (PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, Lisp_CondVar));
  3356   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_MARKER))
  3357     {
  3358       /* sweep_buffer should already have unchained this from its buffer.  */
  3359       eassert (! PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, Lisp_Marker)->buffer);
  3360     }
  3361   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_USER_PTR))
  3362     {
  3363       struct Lisp_User_Ptr *uptr = PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, Lisp_User_Ptr);
  3364       if (uptr->finalizer)
  3365         uptr->finalizer (uptr->p);
  3366     }
  3367 #ifdef HAVE_TREE_SITTER
  3368   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_TS_PARSER))
  3369     treesit_delete_parser (PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, Lisp_TS_Parser));
  3370   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_TS_COMPILED_QUERY))
  3371     treesit_delete_query (PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, Lisp_TS_Query));
  3372 #endif
  3373 #ifdef HAVE_MODULES
  3374   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_MODULE_FUNCTION))
  3375     {
  3376       ATTRIBUTE_MAY_ALIAS struct Lisp_Module_Function *function
  3377         = (struct Lisp_Module_Function *) vector;
  3378       module_finalize_function (function);
  3379     }
  3380 #endif
  3381 #ifdef HAVE_NATIVE_COMP
  3382   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_NATIVE_COMP_UNIT))
  3383     {
  3384       struct Lisp_Native_Comp_Unit *cu =
  3385         PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, Lisp_Native_Comp_Unit);
  3386       unload_comp_unit (cu);
  3387     }
  3388   else if (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPEP (&vector->header, PVEC_SUBR))
  3389     {
  3390       struct Lisp_Subr *subr =
  3391         PSEUDOVEC_STRUCT (vector, Lisp_Subr);
  3392       if (!NILP (subr->native_comp_u))
  3393         {
  3394           /* FIXME Alternative and non invasive solution to this
  3395              cast?  */
  3396           xfree ((char *)subr->symbol_name);
  3397           xfree (subr->native_c_name);
  3398         }
  3399     }
  3400 #endif
  3401 }
  3402 
  3403 /* Reclaim space used by unmarked vectors.  */
  3404 
  3405 NO_INLINE /* For better stack traces */
  3406 static void
  3407 sweep_vectors (void)
  3408 {
  3409   struct vector_block *block, **bprev = &vector_blocks;
  3410   struct large_vector *lv, **lvprev = &large_vectors;
  3411   struct Lisp_Vector *vector, *next;
  3412 
  3413   gcstat.total_vectors = 0;
  3414   gcstat.total_vector_slots = gcstat.total_free_vector_slots = 0;
  3415   memset (vector_free_lists, 0, sizeof (vector_free_lists));
  3416 
  3417   /* Looking through vector blocks.  */
  3418 
  3419   for (block = vector_blocks; block; block = *bprev)
  3420     {
  3421       bool free_this_block = false;
  3422 
  3423       for (vector = (struct Lisp_Vector *) block->data;
  3424            VECTOR_IN_BLOCK (vector, block); vector = next)
  3425         {
  3426           ASAN_UNPOISON_VECTOR_BLOCK (block);
  3427           if (XVECTOR_MARKED_P (vector))
  3428             {
  3429               XUNMARK_VECTOR (vector);
  3430               gcstat.total_vectors++;
  3431               ptrdiff_t nbytes = vector_nbytes (vector);
  3432               gcstat.total_vector_slots += nbytes / word_size;
  3433               next = ADVANCE (vector, nbytes);
  3434             }
  3435           else
  3436             {
  3437               ptrdiff_t total_bytes = 0;
  3438 
  3439               /* While NEXT is not marked, try to coalesce with VECTOR,
  3440                  thus making VECTOR of the largest possible size.  */
  3441 
  3442               next = vector;
  3443               do
  3444                 {
  3445                   cleanup_vector (next);
  3446                   ptrdiff_t nbytes = vector_nbytes (next);
  3447                   total_bytes += nbytes;
  3448                   next = ADVANCE (next, nbytes);
  3449                 }
  3450               while (VECTOR_IN_BLOCK (next, block) && !vector_marked_p (next));
  3451 
  3452               eassert (total_bytes % roundup_size == 0);
  3453 
  3454               if (vector == (struct Lisp_Vector *) block->data
  3455                   && !VECTOR_IN_BLOCK (next, block))
  3456                 /* This block should be freed because all of its
  3457                    space was coalesced into the only free vector.  */
  3458                 free_this_block = true;
  3459               else
  3460                 {
  3461                   setup_on_free_list (vector, total_bytes);
  3462                   gcstat.total_free_vector_slots += total_bytes / word_size;
  3463                 }
  3464             }
  3465         }
  3466 
  3467       if (free_this_block)
  3468         {
  3469           *bprev = block->next;
  3470 #ifndef GC_MALLOC_CHECK
  3471           mem_delete (mem_find (block->data));
  3472 #endif
  3473           xfree (block);
  3474         }
  3475       else
  3476         bprev = &block->next;
  3477     }
  3478 
  3479   /* Sweep large vectors.  */
  3480 
  3481   for (lv = large_vectors; lv; lv = *lvprev)
  3482     {
  3483       vector = large_vector_vec (lv);
  3484       if (XVECTOR_MARKED_P (vector))
  3485         {
  3486           XUNMARK_VECTOR (vector);
  3487           gcstat.total_vectors++;
  3488           gcstat.total_vector_slots
  3489             += (vector->header.size & PSEUDOVECTOR_FLAG
  3490                 ? vector_nbytes (vector) / word_size
  3491                 : header_size / word_size + vector->header.size);
  3492           lvprev = &lv->next;
  3493         }
  3494       else
  3495         {
  3496           *lvprev = lv->next;
  3497           lisp_free (lv);
  3498         }
  3499     }
  3500 }
  3501 
  3502 /* Maximum number of elements in a vector.  This is a macro so that it
  3503    can be used in an integer constant expression.  */
  3504 
  3505 #define VECTOR_ELTS_MAX \
  3506   ((ptrdiff_t) \
  3507    min (((min (PTRDIFF_MAX, SIZE_MAX) - header_size - large_vector_offset) \
  3508          / word_size), \
  3509         MOST_POSITIVE_FIXNUM))
  3510 
  3511 /* Value is a pointer to a newly allocated Lisp_Vector structure
  3512    with room for LEN Lisp_Objects.  LEN must be positive and
  3513    at most VECTOR_ELTS_MAX.  */
  3514 
  3515 static struct Lisp_Vector *
  3516 allocate_vectorlike (ptrdiff_t len, bool clearit)
  3517 {
  3518   eassert (0 < len && len <= VECTOR_ELTS_MAX);
  3519   ptrdiff_t nbytes = header_size + len * word_size;
  3520   struct Lisp_Vector *p;
  3521 
  3522   MALLOC_BLOCK_INPUT;
  3523 
  3524 #ifdef DOUG_LEA_MALLOC
  3525   if (!mmap_lisp_allowed_p ())
  3526     mallopt (M_MMAP_MAX, 0);
  3527 #endif
  3528 
  3529   if (nbytes <= VBLOCK_BYTES_MAX)
  3530     {
  3531       p = allocate_vector_from_block (vroundup (nbytes));
  3532       if (clearit)
  3533         memclear (p, nbytes);
  3534     }
  3535   else
  3536     {
  3537       struct large_vector *lv = lisp_malloc (large_vector_offset + nbytes,
  3538                                              clearit, MEM_TYPE_VECTORLIKE);
  3539       lv->next = large_vectors;
  3540       large_vectors = lv;
  3541       p = large_vector_vec (lv);
  3542     }
  3543 
  3544 #ifdef DOUG_LEA_MALLOC
  3545   if (!mmap_lisp_allowed_p ())
  3546     mallopt (M_MMAP_MAX, MMAP_MAX_AREAS);
  3547 #endif
  3548 
  3549   if (find_suspicious_object_in_range (p, (char *) p + nbytes))
  3550     emacs_abort ();
  3551 
  3552   tally_consing (nbytes);
  3553   vector_cells_consed += len;
  3554 
  3555   MALLOC_UNBLOCK_INPUT;
  3556 
  3557   return p;
  3558 }
  3559 
  3560 
  3561 /* Allocate a vector with LEN slots.  If CLEARIT, clear its slots;
  3562    otherwise the vector's slots are uninitialized.  */
  3563 
  3564 static struct Lisp_Vector *
  3565 allocate_clear_vector (ptrdiff_t len, bool clearit)
  3566 {
  3567   if (len == 0)
  3568     return XVECTOR (zero_vector);
  3569   if (VECTOR_ELTS_MAX < len)
  3570     memory_full (SIZE_MAX);
  3571   struct Lisp_Vector *v = allocate_vectorlike (len, clearit);
  3572   v->header.size = len;
  3573   return v;
  3574 }
  3575 
  3576 /* Allocate a vector with LEN uninitialized slots.  */
  3577 
  3578 struct Lisp_Vector *
  3579 allocate_vector (ptrdiff_t len)
  3580 {
  3581   return allocate_clear_vector (len, false);
  3582 }
  3583 
  3584 /* Allocate a vector with LEN nil slots.  */
  3585 
  3586 struct Lisp_Vector *
  3587 allocate_nil_vector (ptrdiff_t len)
  3588 {
  3589   return allocate_clear_vector (len, true);
  3590 }
  3591 
  3592 
  3593 /* Allocate other vector-like structures.  */
  3594 
  3595 struct Lisp_Vector *
  3596 allocate_pseudovector (int memlen, int lisplen,
  3597                        int zerolen, enum pvec_type tag)
  3598 {
  3599   /* Catch bogus values.  */
  3600   enum { size_max = (1 << PSEUDOVECTOR_SIZE_BITS) - 1 };
  3601   enum { rest_max = (1 << PSEUDOVECTOR_REST_BITS) - 1 };
  3602   verify (size_max + rest_max <= VECTOR_ELTS_MAX);
  3603   eassert (0 <= tag && tag <= PVEC_FONT);
  3604   eassert (0 <= lisplen && lisplen <= zerolen && zerolen <= memlen);
  3605   eassert (lisplen <= size_max);
  3606   eassert (memlen <= size_max + rest_max);
  3607 
  3608   struct Lisp_Vector *v = allocate_vectorlike (memlen, false);
  3609   /* Only the first LISPLEN slots will be traced normally by the GC.  */
  3610   memclear (v->contents, zerolen * word_size);
  3611   XSETPVECTYPESIZE (v, tag, lisplen, memlen - lisplen);
  3612   return v;
  3613 }
  3614 
  3615 struct buffer *
  3616 allocate_buffer (void)
  3617 {
  3618   struct buffer *b
  3619     = ALLOCATE_PSEUDOVECTOR (struct buffer, cursor_in_non_selected_windows_,
  3620                              PVEC_BUFFER);
  3621   BUFFER_PVEC_INIT (b);
  3622   /* Note that the rest fields of B are not initialized.  */
  3623   return b;
  3624 }
  3625 
  3626 
  3627 /* Allocate a record with COUNT slots.  COUNT must be positive, and
  3628    includes the type slot.  */
  3629 
  3630 static struct Lisp_Vector *
  3631 allocate_record (EMACS_INT count)
  3632 {
  3633   if (count > PSEUDOVECTOR_SIZE_MASK)
  3634     error ("Attempt to allocate a record of %"pI"d slots; max is %d",
  3635            count, PSEUDOVECTOR_SIZE_MASK);
  3636   struct Lisp_Vector *p = allocate_vectorlike (count, false);
  3637   p->header.size = count;
  3638   XSETPVECTYPE (p, PVEC_RECORD);
  3639   return p;
  3640 }
  3641 
  3642 
  3643 DEFUN ("make-record", Fmake_record, Smake_record, 3, 3, 0,
  3644        doc: /* Create a new record.
  3645 TYPE is its type as returned by `type-of'; it should be either a
  3646 symbol or a type descriptor.  SLOTS is the number of non-type slots,
  3647 each initialized to INIT.  */)
  3648   (Lisp_Object type, Lisp_Object slots, Lisp_Object init)
  3649 {
  3650   CHECK_FIXNAT (slots);
  3651   EMACS_INT size = XFIXNAT (slots) + 1;
  3652   struct Lisp_Vector *p = allocate_record (size);
  3653   p->contents[0] = type;
  3654   for (ptrdiff_t i = 1; i < size; i++)
  3655     p->contents[i] = init;
  3656   return make_lisp_ptr (p, Lisp_Vectorlike);
  3657 }
  3658 
  3659 
  3660 DEFUN ("record", Frecord, Srecord, 1, MANY, 0,
  3661        doc: /* Create a new record.
  3662 TYPE is its type as returned by `type-of'; it should be either a
  3663 symbol or a type descriptor.  SLOTS is used to initialize the record
  3664 slots with shallow copies of the arguments.
  3665 usage: (record TYPE &rest SLOTS) */)
  3666   (ptrdiff_t nargs, Lisp_Object *args)
  3667 {
  3668   struct Lisp_Vector *p = allocate_record (nargs);
  3669   memcpy (p->contents, args, nargs * sizeof *args);
  3670   return make_lisp_ptr (p, Lisp_Vectorlike);
  3671 }
  3672 
  3673 
  3674 DEFUN ("make-vector", Fmake_vector, Smake_vector, 2, 2, 0,
  3675        doc: /* Return a newly created vector of length LENGTH, with each element being INIT.
  3676 See also the function `vector'.  */)
  3677   (Lisp_Object length, Lisp_Object init)
  3678 {
  3679   CHECK_TYPE (FIXNATP (length) && XFIXNAT (length) <= PTRDIFF_MAX,
  3680               Qwholenump, length);
  3681   return make_vector (XFIXNAT (length), init);
  3682 }
  3683 
  3684 /* Return a new vector of length LENGTH with each element being INIT.  */
  3685 
  3686 Lisp_Object
  3687 make_vector (ptrdiff_t length, Lisp_Object init)
  3688 {
  3689   bool clearit = NIL_IS_ZERO && NILP (init);
  3690   struct Lisp_Vector *p = allocate_clear_vector (length, clearit);
  3691   if (!clearit)
  3692     for (ptrdiff_t i = 0; i < length; i++)
  3693       p->contents[i] = init;
  3694   return make_lisp_ptr (p, Lisp_Vectorlike);
  3695 }
  3696 
  3697 DEFUN ("vector", Fvector, Svector, 0, MANY, 0,
  3698        doc: /* Return a newly created vector with specified arguments as elements.
  3699 Allows any number of arguments, including zero.
  3700 usage: (vector &rest OBJECTS)  */)
  3701   (ptrdiff_t nargs, Lisp_Object *args)
  3702 {
  3703   Lisp_Object val = make_uninit_vector (nargs);
  3704   struct Lisp_Vector *p = XVECTOR (val);
  3705   memcpy (p->contents, args, nargs * sizeof *args);
  3706   return val;
  3707 }
  3708 
  3709 DEFUN ("make-byte-code", Fmake_byte_code, Smake_byte_code, 4, MANY, 0,
  3710        doc: /* Create a byte-code object with specified arguments as elements.
  3711 The arguments should be the ARGLIST, bytecode-string BYTE-CODE, constant
  3712 vector CONSTANTS, maximum stack size DEPTH, (optional) DOCSTRING,
  3713 and (optional) INTERACTIVE-SPEC.
  3714 The first four arguments are required; at most six have any
  3715 significance.
  3716 The ARGLIST can be either like the one of `lambda', in which case the arguments
  3717 will be dynamically bound before executing the byte code, or it can be an
  3718 integer of the form NNNNNNNRMMMMMMM where the 7bit MMMMMMM specifies the
  3719 minimum number of arguments, the 7-bit NNNNNNN specifies the maximum number
  3720 of arguments (ignoring &rest) and the R bit specifies whether there is a &rest
  3721 argument to catch the left-over arguments.  If such an integer is used, the
  3722 arguments will not be dynamically bound but will be instead pushed on the
  3723 stack before executing the byte-code.
  3724 usage: (make-byte-code ARGLIST BYTE-CODE CONSTANTS DEPTH &optional DOCSTRING INTERACTIVE-SPEC &rest ELEMENTS)  */)
  3725   (ptrdiff_t nargs, Lisp_Object *args)
  3726 {
  3727   if (! ((FIXNUMP (args[COMPILED_ARGLIST])
  3728           || CONSP (args[COMPILED_ARGLIST])
  3729           || NILP (args[COMPILED_ARGLIST]))
  3730          && STRINGP (args[COMPILED_BYTECODE])
  3731          && !STRING_MULTIBYTE (args[COMPILED_BYTECODE])
  3732          && VECTORP (args[COMPILED_CONSTANTS])
  3733          && FIXNATP (args[COMPILED_STACK_DEPTH])))
  3734     error ("Invalid byte-code object");
  3735 
  3736   /* Bytecode must be immovable.  */
  3737   pin_string (args[COMPILED_BYTECODE]);
  3738 
  3739   /* We used to purecopy everything here, if purify-flag was set.  This worked
  3740      OK for Emacs-23, but with Emacs-24's lexical binding code, it can be
  3741      dangerous, since make-byte-code is used during execution to build
  3742      closures, so any closure built during the preload phase would end up
  3743      copied into pure space, including its free variables, which is sometimes
  3744      just wasteful and other times plainly wrong (e.g. those free vars may want
  3745      to be setcar'd).  */
  3746   Lisp_Object val = Fvector (nargs, args);
  3747   XSETPVECTYPE (XVECTOR (val), PVEC_COMPILED);
  3748   return val;
  3749 }
  3750 
  3751 DEFUN ("make-closure", Fmake_closure, Smake_closure, 1, MANY, 0,
  3752        doc: /* Create a byte-code closure from PROTOTYPE and CLOSURE-VARS.
  3753 Return a copy of PROTOTYPE, a byte-code object, with CLOSURE-VARS
  3754 replacing the elements in the beginning of the constant-vector.
  3755 usage: (make-closure PROTOTYPE &rest CLOSURE-VARS) */)
  3756   (ptrdiff_t nargs, Lisp_Object *args)
  3757 {
  3758   Lisp_Object protofun = args[0];
  3759   CHECK_TYPE (COMPILEDP (protofun), Qbyte_code_function_p, protofun);
  3760 
  3761   /* Create a copy of the constant vector, filling it with the closure
  3762      variables in the beginning.  (The overwritten part should just
  3763      contain placeholder values.) */
  3764   Lisp_Object proto_constvec = AREF (protofun, COMPILED_CONSTANTS);
  3765   ptrdiff_t constsize = ASIZE (proto_constvec);
  3766   ptrdiff_t nvars = nargs - 1;
  3767   if (nvars > constsize)
  3768     error ("Closure vars do not fit in constvec");
  3769   Lisp_Object constvec = make_uninit_vector (constsize);
  3770   memcpy (XVECTOR (constvec)->contents, args + 1, nvars * word_size);
  3771   memcpy (XVECTOR (constvec)->contents + nvars,
  3772           XVECTOR (proto_constvec)->contents + nvars,
  3773           (constsize - nvars) * word_size);
  3774 
  3775   /* Return a copy of the prototype function with the new constant vector. */
  3776   ptrdiff_t protosize = PVSIZE (protofun);
  3777   struct Lisp_Vector *v = allocate_vectorlike (protosize, false);
  3778   v->header = XVECTOR (protofun)->header;
  3779   memcpy (v->contents, XVECTOR (protofun)->contents, protosize * word_size);
  3780   v->contents[COMPILED_CONSTANTS] = constvec;
  3781   return make_lisp_ptr (v, Lisp_Vectorlike);
  3782 }
  3783 
  3784 
  3785 /***********************************************************************
  3786                            Symbol Allocation
  3787  ***********************************************************************/
  3788 
  3789 /* Each symbol_block is just under 1020 bytes long, since malloc
  3790    really allocates in units of powers of two and uses 4 bytes for its
  3791    own overhead.  */
  3792 
  3793 #define SYMBOL_BLOCK_SIZE \
  3794   ((1020 - sizeof (struct symbol_block *)) / sizeof (struct Lisp_Symbol))
  3795 
  3796 struct symbol_block
  3797 {
  3798   /* Place `symbols' first, to preserve alignment.  */
  3799   struct Lisp_Symbol symbols[SYMBOL_BLOCK_SIZE];
  3800   struct symbol_block *next;
  3801 };
  3802 
  3803 #if GC_ASAN_POISON_OBJECTS
  3804 # define ASAN_POISON_SYMBOL_BLOCK(s) \
  3805   __asan_poison_memory_region ((s)->symbols, sizeof ((s)->symbols))
  3806 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_SYMBOL_BLOCK(s) \
  3807   __asan_unpoison_memory_region ((s)->symbols, sizeof ((s)->symbols))
  3808 # define ASAN_POISON_SYMBOL(sym) \
  3809   __asan_poison_memory_region ((sym), sizeof (*(sym)))
  3810 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_SYMBOL(sym) \
  3811   __asan_unpoison_memory_region ((sym), sizeof (*(sym)))
  3812 
  3813 #else
  3814 # define ASAN_POISON_SYMBOL_BLOCK(s) ((void) 0)
  3815 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_SYMBOL_BLOCK(s) ((void) 0)
  3816 # define ASAN_POISON_SYMBOL(sym) ((void) 0)
  3817 # define ASAN_UNPOISON_SYMBOL(sym) ((void) 0)
  3818 #endif
  3819 
  3820 /* Current symbol block and index of first unused Lisp_Symbol
  3821    structure in it.  */
  3822 
  3823 static struct symbol_block *symbol_block;
  3824 static int symbol_block_index = SYMBOL_BLOCK_SIZE;
  3825 /* Pointer to the first symbol_block that contains pinned symbols.
  3826    Tests for 24.4 showed that at dump-time, Emacs contains about 15K symbols,
  3827    10K of which are pinned (and all but 250 of them are interned in obarray),
  3828    whereas a "typical session" has in the order of 30K symbols.
  3829    `symbol_block_pinned' lets mark_pinned_symbols scan only 15K symbols rather
  3830    than 30K to find the 10K symbols we need to mark.  */
  3831 static struct symbol_block *symbol_block_pinned;
  3832 
  3833 /* List of free symbols.  */
  3834 
  3835 static struct Lisp_Symbol *symbol_free_list;
  3836 
  3837 static void
  3838 set_symbol_name (Lisp_Object sym, Lisp_Object name)
  3839 {
  3840   XBARE_SYMBOL (sym)->u.s.name = name;
  3841 }
  3842 
  3843 void
  3844 init_symbol (Lisp_Object val, Lisp_Object name)
  3845 {
  3846   struct Lisp_Symbol *p = XBARE_SYMBOL (val);
  3847   set_symbol_name (val, name);
  3848   set_symbol_plist (val, Qnil);
  3849   p->u.s.redirect = SYMBOL_PLAINVAL;
  3850   SET_SYMBOL_VAL (p, Qunbound);
  3851   set_symbol_function (val, Qnil);
  3852   set_symbol_next (val, NULL);
  3853   p->u.s.gcmarkbit = false;
  3854   p->u.s.interned = SYMBOL_UNINTERNED;
  3855   p->u.s.trapped_write = SYMBOL_UNTRAPPED_WRITE;
  3856   p->u.s.declared_special = false;
  3857   p->u.s.pinned = false;
  3858 }
  3859 
  3860 DEFUN ("make-symbol", Fmake_symbol, Smake_symbol, 1, 1, 0,
  3861        doc: /* Return a newly allocated uninterned symbol whose name is NAME.
  3862 Its value is void, and its function definition and property list are nil.  */)
  3863   (Lisp_Object name)
  3864 {
  3865   Lisp_Object val;
  3866 
  3867   CHECK_STRING (name);
  3868 
  3869   MALLOC_BLOCK_INPUT;
  3870 
  3871   if (symbol_free_list)
  3872     {
  3873       ASAN_UNPOISON_SYMBOL (symbol_free_list);
  3874       XSETSYMBOL (val, symbol_free_list);
  3875       symbol_free_list = symbol_free_list->u.s.next;
  3876     }
  3877   else
  3878     {
  3879       if (symbol_block_index == SYMBOL_BLOCK_SIZE)
  3880         {
  3881           struct symbol_block *new
  3882             = lisp_malloc (sizeof *new, false, MEM_TYPE_SYMBOL);
  3883           ASAN_POISON_SYMBOL_BLOCK (new);
  3884           new->next = symbol_block;
  3885           symbol_block = new;
  3886           symbol_block_index = 0;
  3887         }
  3888 
  3889       ASAN_UNPOISON_SYMBOL (&symbol_block->symbols[symbol_block_index]);
  3890       XSETSYMBOL (val, &symbol_block->symbols[symbol_block_index]);
  3891       symbol_block_index++;
  3892     }
  3893 
  3894   MALLOC_UNBLOCK_INPUT;
  3895 
  3896   init_symbol (val, name);
  3897   tally_consing (sizeof (struct Lisp_Symbol));
  3898   symbols_consed++;
  3899   return val;
  3900 }
  3901 
  3902 
  3903 
  3904 Lisp_Object
  3905 make_misc_ptr (void *a)
  3906 {
  3907   struct Lisp_Misc_Ptr *p = ALLOCATE_PLAIN_PSEUDOVECTOR (struct Lisp_Misc_Ptr,
  3908                                                          PVEC_MISC_PTR);
  3909   p->pointer = a;
  3910   return make_lisp_ptr (p, Lisp_Vectorlike);
  3911 }
  3912 
  3913 /* Return a new symbol with position with the specified SYMBOL and POSITION. */
  3914 Lisp_Object
  3915 build_symbol_with_pos (Lisp_Object symbol, Lisp_Object position)
  3916 {
  3917   Lisp_Object val;
  3918   struct Lisp_Symbol_With_Pos *p
  3919     = (struct Lisp_Symbol_With_Pos *) allocate_vector (2);
  3920   XSETVECTOR (val, p);
  3921   XSETPVECTYPESIZE (XVECTOR (val), PVEC_SYMBOL_WITH_POS, 2, 0);
  3922   p->sym = symbol;
  3923   p->pos = position;
  3924 
  3925   return val;
  3926 }
  3927 
  3928 /* Return a new (deleted) overlay with PLIST.  */
  3929 
  3930 Lisp_Object
  3931 build_overlay (bool front_advance, bool rear_advance,
  3932                Lisp_Object plist)
  3933 {
  3934   struct Lisp_Overlay *p = ALLOCATE_PSEUDOVECTOR (struct Lisp_Overlay, plist,
  3935                                                   PVEC_OVERLAY);
  3936   Lisp_Object overlay = make_lisp_ptr (p, Lisp_Vectorlike);
  3937   struct itree_node *node = xmalloc (sizeof (*node));
  3938   itree_node_init (node, front_advance, rear_advance, overlay);
  3939   p->interval = node;
  3940   p->buffer = NULL;
  3941   set_overlay_plist (overlay, plist);
  3942   return overlay;
  3943 }
  3944 
  3945 DEFUN ("make-marker", Fmake_marker, Smake_marker, 0, 0, 0,
  3946        doc: /* Return a newly allocated marker which does not point at any place.  */)
  3947   (void)
  3948 {
  3949   struct Lisp_Marker *p = ALLOCATE_PLAIN_PSEUDOVECTOR (struct Lisp_Marker,
  3950                                                        PVEC_MARKER);
  3951   p->buffer = 0;
  3952   p->bytepos = 0;
  3953   p->charpos = 0;
  3954   p->next = NULL;
  3955   p->insertion_type = 0;
  3956   p->need_adjustment = 0;
  3957   return make_lisp_ptr (p, Lisp_Vectorlike);
  3958 }
  3959 
  3960 /* Return a newly allocated marker which points into BUF
  3961    at character position CHARPOS and byte position BYTEPOS.  */
  3962 
  3963 Lisp_Object
  3964 build_marker (struct buffer *buf, ptrdiff_t charpos, ptrdiff_t bytepos)
  3965 {
  3966   /* No dead buffers here.  */
  3967   eassert (BUFFER_LIVE_P (buf));
  3968 
  3969   /* Every character is at least one byte.  */
  3970   eassert (charpos <= bytepos);
  3971 
  3972   struct Lisp_Marker *m = ALLOCATE_PLAIN_PSEUDOVECTOR (struct Lisp_Marker,
  3973                                                        PVEC_MARKER);
  3974   m->buffer = buf;
  3975   m->charpos = charpos;
  3976   m->bytepos = bytepos;
  3977   m->insertion_type = 0;
  3978   m->need_adjustment = 0;
  3979   m->next = BUF_MARKERS (buf);
  3980   BUF_MARKERS (buf) = m;
  3981   return make_lisp_ptr (m, Lisp_Vectorlike);
  3982 }
  3983 
  3984 
  3985 /* Return a newly created vector or string with specified arguments as
  3986    elements.  If all the arguments are characters that can fit
  3987    in a string of events, make a string; otherwise, make a vector.
  3988 
  3989    Allows any number of arguments, including zero.  */
  3990 
  3991 Lisp_Object
  3992 make_event_array (ptrdiff_t nargs, Lisp_Object *args)
  3993 {
  3994   ptrdiff_t i;
  3995 
  3996   for (i = 0; i < nargs; i++)
  3997     /* The things that fit in a string
  3998        are characters that are in 0...127,
  3999        after discarding the meta bit and all the bits above it.  */
  4000     if (!FIXNUMP (args[i])
  4001         || (XFIXNUM (args[i]) & ~(-CHAR_META)) >= 0200)
  4002       return Fvector (nargs, args);
  4003 
  4004   /* Since the loop exited, we know that all the things in it are
  4005      characters, so we can make a string.  */
  4006   {
  4007     Lisp_Object result;
  4008 
  4009     result = Fmake_string (make_fixnum (nargs), make_fixnum (0), Qnil);
  4010     for (i = 0; i < nargs; i++)
  4011       {
  4012         SSET (result, i, XFIXNUM (args[i]));
  4013         /* Move the meta bit to the right place for a string char.  */
  4014         if (XFIXNUM (args[i]) & CHAR_META)
  4015           SSET (result, i, SREF (result, i) | 0x80);
  4016       }
  4017 
  4018     return result;
  4019   }
  4020 }
  4021 
  4022 #ifdef HAVE_MODULES
  4023 /* Create a new module user ptr object.  */
  4024 Lisp_Object
  4025 make_user_ptr (void (*finalizer) (void *), void *p)
  4026 {
  4027   struct Lisp_User_Ptr *uptr
  4028     = ALLOCATE_PLAIN_PSEUDOVECTOR (struct Lisp_User_Ptr, PVEC_USER_PTR);
  4029   uptr->finalizer = finalizer;
  4030   uptr->p = p;
  4031   return make_lisp_ptr (uptr, Lisp_Vectorlike);
  4032 }
  4033 #endif
  4034 
  4035 static void
  4036 init_finalizer_list (struct Lisp_Finalizer *head)
  4037 {
  4038   head->prev = head->next = head;
  4039 }
  4040 
  4041 /* Insert FINALIZER before ELEMENT.  */
  4042 
  4043 static void
  4044 finalizer_insert (struct Lisp_Finalizer *element,
  4045                   struct Lisp_Finalizer *finalizer)
  4046 {
  4047   eassert (finalizer->prev == NULL);
  4048   eassert (finalizer->next == NULL);
  4049   finalizer->next = element;
  4050   finalizer->prev = element->prev;
  4051   finalizer->prev->next = finalizer;
  4052   element->prev = finalizer;
  4053 }
  4054 
  4055 static void
  4056 unchain_finalizer (struct Lisp_Finalizer *finalizer)
  4057 {
  4058   if (finalizer->prev != NULL)
  4059     {
  4060       eassert (finalizer->next != NULL);
  4061       finalizer->prev->next = finalizer->next;
  4062       finalizer->next->prev = finalizer->prev;
  4063       finalizer->prev = finalizer->next = NULL;
  4064     }
  4065 }
  4066 
  4067 static void
  4068 mark_finalizer_list (struct Lisp_Finalizer *head)
  4069 {
  4070   for (struct Lisp_Finalizer *finalizer = head->next;
  4071        finalizer != head;
  4072        finalizer = finalizer->next)
  4073     {
  4074       set_vectorlike_marked (&finalizer->header);
  4075       mark_object (finalizer->function);
  4076     }
  4077 }
  4078 
  4079 /* Move doomed finalizers to list DEST from list SRC.  A doomed
  4080    finalizer is one that is not GC-reachable and whose
  4081    finalizer->function is non-nil.  */
  4082 
  4083 static void
  4084 queue_doomed_finalizers (struct Lisp_Finalizer *dest,
  4085                          struct Lisp_Finalizer *src)
  4086 {
  4087   struct Lisp_Finalizer *finalizer = src->next;
  4088   while (finalizer != src)
  4089     {
  4090       struct Lisp_Finalizer *next = finalizer->next;
  4091       if (!vectorlike_marked_p (&finalizer->header)
  4092           && !NILP (finalizer->function))
  4093         {
  4094           unchain_finalizer (finalizer);
  4095           finalizer_insert (dest, finalizer);
  4096         }
  4097 
  4098       finalizer = next;
  4099     }
  4100 }
  4101 
  4102 static Lisp_Object
  4103 run_finalizer_handler (Lisp_Object args)
  4104 {
  4105   add_to_log ("finalizer failed: %S", args);
  4106   return Qnil;
  4107 }
  4108 
  4109 static void
  4110 run_finalizer_function (Lisp_Object function)
  4111 {
  4112   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  4113 #ifdef HAVE_PDUMPER
  4114   ++number_finalizers_run;
  4115 #endif
  4116 
  4117   specbind (Qinhibit_quit, Qt);
  4118   internal_condition_case_1 (call0, function, Qt, run_finalizer_handler);
  4119   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  4120 }
  4121 
  4122 static void
  4123 run_finalizers (struct Lisp_Finalizer *finalizers)
  4124 {
  4125   struct Lisp_Finalizer *finalizer;
  4126   Lisp_Object function;
  4127 
  4128   while (finalizers->next != finalizers)
  4129     {
  4130       finalizer = finalizers->next;
  4131       unchain_finalizer (finalizer);
  4132       function = finalizer->function;
  4133       if (!NILP (function))
  4134         {
  4135           finalizer->function = Qnil;
  4136           run_finalizer_function (function);
  4137         }
  4138     }
  4139 }
  4140 
  4141 DEFUN ("make-finalizer", Fmake_finalizer, Smake_finalizer, 1, 1, 0,
  4142        doc: /* Make a finalizer that will run FUNCTION.
  4143 FUNCTION will be called after garbage collection when the returned
  4144 finalizer object becomes unreachable.  If the finalizer object is
  4145 reachable only through references from finalizer objects, it does not
  4146 count as reachable for the purpose of deciding whether to run
  4147 FUNCTION.  FUNCTION will be run once per finalizer object.  */)
  4148   (Lisp_Object function)
  4149 {
  4150   CHECK_TYPE (FUNCTIONP (function), Qfunctionp, function);
  4151   struct Lisp_Finalizer *finalizer
  4152     = ALLOCATE_PSEUDOVECTOR (struct Lisp_Finalizer, function, PVEC_FINALIZER);
  4153   finalizer->function = function;
  4154   finalizer->prev = finalizer->next = NULL;
  4155   finalizer_insert (&finalizers, finalizer);
  4156   return make_lisp_ptr (finalizer, Lisp_Vectorlike);
  4157 }
  4158 
  4159 
  4160 /************************************************************************
  4161                          Mark bit access functions
  4162  ************************************************************************/
  4163 
  4164 /* With the rare exception of functions implementing block-based
  4165    allocation of various types, you should not directly test or set GC
  4166    mark bits on objects.  Some objects might live in special memory
  4167    regions (e.g., a dump image) and might store their mark bits
  4168    elsewhere.  */
  4169 
  4170 static bool
  4171 vector_marked_p (const struct Lisp_Vector *v)
  4172 {
  4173   if (pdumper_object_p (v))
  4174     {
  4175       /* Look at cold_start first so that we don't have to fault in
  4176          the vector header just to tell that it's a bool vector.  */
  4177       if (pdumper_cold_object_p (v))
  4178         {
  4179           eassert (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPE (v) == PVEC_BOOL_VECTOR);
  4180           return true;
  4181         }
  4182       return pdumper_marked_p (v);
  4183     }
  4184   return XVECTOR_MARKED_P (v);
  4185 }
  4186 
  4187 static void
  4188 set_vector_marked (struct Lisp_Vector *v)
  4189 {
  4190   if (pdumper_object_p (v))
  4191     {
  4192       eassert (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPE (v) != PVEC_BOOL_VECTOR);
  4193       pdumper_set_marked (v);
  4194     }
  4195   else
  4196     XMARK_VECTOR (v);
  4197 }
  4198 
  4199 static bool
  4200 vectorlike_marked_p (const union vectorlike_header *header)
  4201 {
  4202   return vector_marked_p ((const struct Lisp_Vector *) header);
  4203 }
  4204 
  4205 static void
  4206 set_vectorlike_marked (union vectorlike_header *header)
  4207 {
  4208   set_vector_marked ((struct Lisp_Vector *) header);
  4209 }
  4210 
  4211 static bool
  4212 cons_marked_p (const struct Lisp_Cons *c)
  4213 {
  4214   return pdumper_object_p (c)
  4215     ? pdumper_marked_p (c)
  4216     : XCONS_MARKED_P (c);
  4217 }
  4218 
  4219 static void
  4220 set_cons_marked (struct Lisp_Cons *c)
  4221 {
  4222   if (pdumper_object_p (c))
  4223     pdumper_set_marked (c);
  4224   else
  4225     XMARK_CONS (c);
  4226 }
  4227 
  4228 static bool
  4229 string_marked_p (const struct Lisp_String *s)
  4230 {
  4231   return pdumper_object_p (s)
  4232     ? pdumper_marked_p (s)
  4233     : XSTRING_MARKED_P (s);
  4234 }
  4235 
  4236 static void
  4237 set_string_marked (struct Lisp_String *s)
  4238 {
  4239   if (pdumper_object_p (s))
  4240     pdumper_set_marked (s);
  4241   else
  4242     XMARK_STRING (s);
  4243 }
  4244 
  4245 static bool
  4246 symbol_marked_p (const struct Lisp_Symbol *s)
  4247 {
  4248   return pdumper_object_p (s)
  4249     ? pdumper_marked_p (s)
  4250     : s->u.s.gcmarkbit;
  4251 }
  4252 
  4253 static void
  4254 set_symbol_marked (struct Lisp_Symbol *s)
  4255 {
  4256   if (pdumper_object_p (s))
  4257     pdumper_set_marked (s);
  4258   else
  4259     s->u.s.gcmarkbit = true;
  4260 }
  4261 
  4262 static bool
  4263 interval_marked_p (INTERVAL i)
  4264 {
  4265   return pdumper_object_p (i)
  4266     ? pdumper_marked_p (i)
  4267     : i->gcmarkbit;
  4268 }
  4269 
  4270 static void
  4271 set_interval_marked (INTERVAL i)
  4272 {
  4273   if (pdumper_object_p (i))
  4274     pdumper_set_marked (i);
  4275   else
  4276     i->gcmarkbit = true;
  4277 }
  4278 
  4279 
  4280 /************************************************************************
  4281                            Memory Full Handling
  4282  ************************************************************************/
  4283 
  4284 
  4285 /* Called if malloc (NBYTES) returns zero.  If NBYTES == SIZE_MAX,
  4286    there may have been size_t overflow so that malloc was never
  4287    called, or perhaps malloc was invoked successfully but the
  4288    resulting pointer had problems fitting into a tagged EMACS_INT.  In
  4289    either case this counts as memory being full even though malloc did
  4290    not fail.  */
  4291 
  4292 void
  4293 memory_full (size_t nbytes)
  4294 {
  4295   if (!initialized)
  4296     fatal ("memory exhausted");
  4297 
  4298   /* Do not go into hysterics merely because a large request failed.  */
  4299   bool enough_free_memory = false;
  4300   if (SPARE_MEMORY < nbytes)
  4301     {
  4302       void *p;
  4303 
  4304       MALLOC_BLOCK_INPUT;
  4305       p = malloc (SPARE_MEMORY);
  4306       if (p)
  4307         {
  4308           free (p);
  4309           enough_free_memory = true;
  4310         }
  4311       MALLOC_UNBLOCK_INPUT;
  4312     }
  4313 
  4314   if (! enough_free_memory)
  4315     {
  4316       Vmemory_full = Qt;
  4317       consing_until_gc = min (consing_until_gc, memory_full_cons_threshold);
  4318 
  4319       /* The first time we get here, free the spare memory.  */
  4320       for (int i = 0; i < ARRAYELTS (spare_memory); i++)
  4321         if (spare_memory[i])
  4322           {
  4323             if (i == 0)
  4324               free (spare_memory[i]);
  4325             else if (i >= 1 && i <= 4)
  4326               lisp_align_free (spare_memory[i]);
  4327             else
  4328               lisp_free (spare_memory[i]);
  4329             spare_memory[i] = 0;
  4330           }
  4331     }
  4332 
  4333   /* This used to call error, but if we've run out of memory, we could
  4334      get infinite recursion trying to build the string.  */
  4335   xsignal (Qnil, Vmemory_signal_data);
  4336 }
  4337 
  4338 /* If we released our reserve (due to running out of memory),
  4339    and we have a fair amount free once again,
  4340    try to set aside another reserve in case we run out once more.
  4341 
  4342    This is called when a relocatable block is freed in ralloc.c,
  4343    and also directly from this file, in case we're not using ralloc.c.  */
  4344 
  4345 void
  4346 refill_memory_reserve (void)
  4347 {
  4348 #if !defined SYSTEM_MALLOC && !defined HYBRID_MALLOC
  4349   if (spare_memory[0] == 0)
  4350     spare_memory[0] = malloc (SPARE_MEMORY);
  4351   if (spare_memory[1] == 0)
  4352     spare_memory[1] = lisp_align_malloc (sizeof (struct cons_block),
  4353                                                   MEM_TYPE_SPARE);
  4354   if (spare_memory[2] == 0)
  4355     spare_memory[2] = lisp_align_malloc (sizeof (struct cons_block),
  4356                                          MEM_TYPE_SPARE);
  4357   if (spare_memory[3] == 0)
  4358     spare_memory[3] = lisp_align_malloc (sizeof (struct cons_block),
  4359                                          MEM_TYPE_SPARE);
  4360   if (spare_memory[4] == 0)
  4361     spare_memory[4] = lisp_align_malloc (sizeof (struct cons_block),
  4362                                          MEM_TYPE_SPARE);
  4363   if (spare_memory[5] == 0)
