  6574 using the \"unexec\" method, `garbage-collect' returns nil, because
  6575 real GC can't be done.
  6576 
  6577 Note that calling this function does not guarantee that absolutely all
  6578 unreachable objects will be garbage-collected.  Emacs uses a
  6579 mark-and-sweep garbage collector, but is conservative when it comes to
  6580 collecting objects in some circumstances.
  6581 
  6582 For further details, see Info node `(elisp)Garbage Collection'.  */)
  6583   (void)
  6584 {
  6585   if (garbage_collection_inhibited)
  6586     return Qnil;
  6587 
  6588   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  6589   specbind (Qsymbols_with_pos_enabled, Qnil);
  6590   garbage_collect ();
  6591   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  6592   struct gcstat gcst = gcstat;
  6593 
  6594   Lisp_Object total[] = {
  6595     list4 (Qconses, make_fixnum (sizeof (struct Lisp_Cons)),
  6596            make_int (gcst.total_conses),
  6597            make_int (gcst.total_free_conses)),
  6598     list4 (Qsymbols, make_fixnum (sizeof (struct Lisp_Symbol)),
  6599            make_int (gcst.total_symbols),
  6600            make_int (gcst.total_free_symbols)),
  6601     list4 (Qstrings, make_fixnum (sizeof (struct Lisp_String)),
  6602            make_int (gcst.total_strings),
  6603            make_int (gcst.total_free_strings)),
  6604     list3 (Qstring_bytes, make_fixnum (1),
  6605            make_int (gcst.total_string_bytes)),
  6606     list3 (Qvectors,
  6607            make_fixnum (header_size + sizeof (Lisp_Object)),
  6608            make_int (gcst.total_vectors)),
  6609     list4 (Qvector_slots, make_fixnum (word_size),
  6610            make_int (gcst.total_vector_slots),
  6611            make_int (gcst.total_free_vector_slots)),
  6612     list4 (Qfloats, make_fixnum (sizeof (struct Lisp_Float)),
  6613            make_int (gcst.total_floats),
  6614            make_int (gcst.total_free_floats)),
  6615     list4 (Qintervals, make_fixnum (sizeof (struct interval)),
  6616            make_int (gcst.total_intervals),
  6617            make_int (gcst.total_free_intervals)),
  6618     list3 (Qbuffers, make_fixnum (sizeof (struct buffer)),
  6619            make_int (gcst.total_buffers)),
  6620 
  6621 #ifdef DOUG_LEA_MALLOC
  6622     list4 (Qheap, make_fixnum (1024),
  6623            make_int ((mallinfo ().uordblks + 1023) >> 10),
  6624            make_int ((mallinfo ().fordblks + 1023) >> 10)),
  6625 #endif
  6626   };
  6627   return CALLMANY (Flist, total);
  6628 }
  6629 
  6630 DEFUN ("garbage-collect-maybe", Fgarbage_collect_maybe,
  6631 Sgarbage_collect_maybe, 1, 1, 0,
  6632        doc: /* Call `garbage-collect' if enough allocation happened.
  6633 FACTOR determines what "enough" means here:
  6634 If FACTOR is a positive number N, it means to run GC if more than
  6635 1/Nth of the allocations needed to trigger automatic allocation took
  6636 place.
  6637 Therefore, as N gets higher, this is more likely to perform a GC.
  6638 Returns non-nil if GC happened, and nil otherwise.  */)
  6639   (Lisp_Object factor)
  6640 {
  6641   CHECK_FIXNAT (factor);
  6642   EMACS_INT fact = XFIXNAT (factor);
  6643 
  6644   EMACS_INT since_gc = gc_threshold - consing_until_gc;
  6645   if (fact >= 1 && since_gc > gc_threshold / fact)
  6646     {
  6647       garbage_collect ();
  6648       return Qt;
  6649     }
  6650   else
  6651     return Qnil;
  6652 }
  6653 
  6654 /* Mark Lisp objects in glyph matrix MATRIX.  Currently the
  6655    only interesting objects referenced from glyphs are strings.  */
  6656 
  6657 static void
  6658 mark_glyph_matrix (struct glyph_matrix *matrix)
  6659 {
  6660   struct glyph_row *row = matrix->rows;
  6661   struct glyph_row *end = row + matrix->nrows;
  6662 
  6663   for (; row < end; ++row)
  6664     if (row->enabled_p)
  6665       {
  6666         int area;
  6667         for (area = LEFT_MARGIN_AREA; area < LAST_AREA; ++area)
  6668           {
  6669             struct glyph *glyph = row->glyphs[area];
  6670             struct glyph *end_glyph = glyph + row->used[area];
  6671 
  6672             for (; glyph < end_glyph; ++glyph)
  6673               if (STRINGP (glyph->object)
  6674                   && !string_marked_p (XSTRING (glyph->object)))
  6675                 mark_object (glyph->object);
  6676           }
  6677       }
  6678 }
  6679 
  6680 /* Whether to remember a few of the last marked values for debugging.  */
  6681 #define GC_REMEMBER_LAST_MARKED 0
  6682 
  6683 #if GC_REMEMBER_LAST_MARKED
  6684 enum { LAST_MARKED_SIZE = 1 << 9 }; /* Must be a power of 2.  */
  6685 Lisp_Object last_marked[LAST_MARKED_SIZE] EXTERNALLY_VISIBLE;
  6686 static int last_marked_index;
  6687 #endif
  6688 
  6689 /* Whether to enable the mark_object_loop_halt debugging feature.  */
  6690 #define GC_CDR_COUNT 0
  6691 
  6692 #if GC_CDR_COUNT
  6693 /* For debugging--call abort when we cdr down this many
  6694    links of a list, in mark_object.  In debugging,
  6695    the call to abort will hit a breakpoint.
  6696    Normally this is zero and the check never goes off.  */
  6697 ptrdiff_t mark_object_loop_halt EXTERNALLY_VISIBLE;
  6698 #endif
  6699 
  6700 static void
  6701 mark_vectorlike (union vectorlike_header *header)
  6702 {
  6703   struct Lisp_Vector *ptr = (struct Lisp_Vector *) header;
  6704   ptrdiff_t size = ptr->header.size;
  6705 
  6706   eassert (!vector_marked_p (ptr));
  6707 
  6708   /* Bool vectors have a different case in mark_object.  */
  6709   eassert (PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPE (ptr) != PVEC_BOOL_VECTOR);
  6710 
  6711   set_vector_marked (ptr); /* Else mark it.  */
  6712   if (size & PSEUDOVECTOR_FLAG)
  6713     size &= PSEUDOVECTOR_SIZE_MASK;
  6714 
  6715   /* Note that this size is not the memory-footprint size, but only
  6716      the number of Lisp_Object fields that we should trace.
  6717      The distinction is used e.g. by Lisp_Process which places extra
  6718      non-Lisp_Object fields at the end of the structure...  */
  6719   mark_objects (ptr->contents, size);
  6720 }
  6721 
  6722 /* Like mark_vectorlike but optimized for char-tables (and
  6723    sub-char-tables) assuming that the contents are mostly integers or
  6724    symbols.  */
  6725 
  6726 static void
  6727 mark_char_table (struct Lisp_Vector *ptr, enum pvec_type pvectype)
  6728 {
  6729   int size = ptr->header.size & PSEUDOVECTOR_SIZE_MASK;
  6730   /* Consult the Lisp_Sub_Char_Table layout before changing this.  */
  6731   int i, idx = (pvectype == PVEC_SUB_CHAR_TABLE ? SUB_CHAR_TABLE_OFFSET : 0);
  6732 
  6733   eassert (!vector_marked_p (ptr));
  6734   set_vector_marked (ptr);
  6735   for (i = idx; i < size; i++)
  6736     {
  6737       Lisp_Object val = ptr->contents[i];
  6738 
  6739       if (FIXNUMP (val) ||
  6740           (BARE_SYMBOL_P (val) && symbol_marked_p (XBARE_SYMBOL (val))))
  6741         continue;
  6742       if (SUB_CHAR_TABLE_P (val))
  6743         {
  6744           if (! vector_marked_p (XVECTOR (val)))
  6745             mark_char_table (XVECTOR (val), PVEC_SUB_CHAR_TABLE);
  6746         }
  6747       else
  6748         mark_object (val);
  6749     }
  6750 }
  6751 
  6752 /* Mark the chain of overlays starting at PTR.  */
  6753 
  6754 static void
  6755 mark_overlay (struct Lisp_Overlay *ov)
  6756 {
  6757   /* We don't mark the `itree_node` object, because it is managed manually
  6758      rather than by the GC.  */
  6759   eassert (BASE_EQ (ov->interval->data, make_lisp_ptr (ov, Lisp_Vectorlike)));
  6760   set_vectorlike_marked (&ov->header);
  6761   mark_object (ov->plist);
  6762 }
  6763 
  6764 /* Mark the overlay subtree rooted at NODE.  */
  6765 
  6766 static void
  6767 mark_overlays (struct itree_node *node)
  6768 {
  6769   if (node == NULL)
  6770     return;
  6771   mark_object (node->data);
  6772   mark_overlays (node->left);
  6773   mark_overlays (node->right);
  6774 }
  6775 
  6776 /* Mark Lisp_Objects and special pointers in BUFFER.  */
  6777 
  6778 static void
  6779 mark_buffer (struct buffer *buffer)
  6780 {
  6781   /* This is handled much like other pseudovectors...  */
  6782   mark_vectorlike (&buffer->header);
  6783 
  6784   /* ...but there are some buffer-specific things.  */
  6785 
  6786   mark_interval_tree (buffer_intervals (buffer));
  6787 
  6788   /* For now, we just don't mark the undo_list.  It's done later in
  6789      a special way just before the sweep phase, and after stripping
  6790      some of its elements that are not needed any more.
  6791      Note: this later processing is only done for live buffers, so
  6792      for dead buffers, the undo_list should be nil (set by Fkill_buffer),
  6793      but just to be on the safe side, we mark it here.  */
  6794   if (!BUFFER_LIVE_P (buffer))
  6795       mark_object (BVAR (buffer, undo_list));
  6796 
  6797   if (!itree_empty_p (buffer->overlays))
  6798     mark_overlays (buffer->overlays->root);
  6799 
  6800   /* If this is an indirect buffer, mark its base buffer.  */
  6801   if (buffer->base_buffer &&
  6802       !vectorlike_marked_p (&buffer->base_buffer->header))
  6803     mark_buffer (buffer->base_buffer);
  6804 }
  6805 
  6806 /* Mark Lisp faces in the face cache C.  */
  6807 
  6808 NO_INLINE /* To reduce stack depth in mark_object.  */
  6809 static void
  6810 mark_face_cache (struct face_cache *c)
  6811 {
  6812   if (c)
  6813     {
  6814       for (int i = 0; i < c->used; i++)
  6815         {
  6816           struct face *face = FACE_FROM_ID_OR_NULL (c->f, i);
  6817 
  6818           if (face)
  6819             {
  6820               if (face->font && !vectorlike_marked_p (&face->font->header))
  6821                 mark_vectorlike (&face->font->header);
  6822 
  6823               mark_objects (face->lface, LFACE_VECTOR_SIZE);
  6824             }
  6825         }
  6826     }
  6827 }
  6828 
  6829 NO_INLINE /* To reduce stack depth in mark_object.  */
  6830 static void
  6831 mark_localized_symbol (struct Lisp_Symbol *ptr)
  6832 {
  6833   struct Lisp_Buffer_Local_Value *blv = SYMBOL_BLV (ptr);
  6834   Lisp_Object where = blv->where;
  6835   /* If the value is set up for a killed buffer restore its global binding.  */
  6836   if ((BUFFERP (where) && !BUFFER_LIVE_P (XBUFFER (where))))
  6837     swap_in_global_binding (ptr);
  6838   mark_object (blv->where);
  6839   mark_object (blv->valcell);
  6840   mark_object (blv->defcell);
  6841 }
  6842 
  6843 /* Remove killed buffers or items whose car is a killed buffer from
  6844    LIST, and mark other items.  Return changed LIST, which is marked.  */
  6845 
  6846 static Lisp_Object
  6847 mark_discard_killed_buffers (Lisp_Object list)
  6848 {
  6849   Lisp_Object tail, *prev = &list;
  6850 
  6851   for (tail = list; CONSP (tail) && !cons_marked_p (XCONS (tail));
  6852        tail = XCDR (tail))
  6853     {
  6854       Lisp_Object tem = XCAR (tail);
  6855       if (CONSP (tem))
  6856         tem = XCAR (tem);
  6857       if (BUFFERP (tem) && !BUFFER_LIVE_P (XBUFFER (tem)))
  6858         *prev = XCDR (tail);
  6859       else
  6860         {
  6861           set_cons_marked (XCONS (tail));
  6862           mark_object (XCAR (tail));
  6863           prev = xcdr_addr (tail);
  6864         }
  6865     }
  6866   mark_object (tail);
  6867   return list;
  6868 }
  6869 
  6870 static void
  6871 mark_frame (struct Lisp_Vector *ptr)
  6872 {
  6873   struct frame *f = (struct frame *) ptr;
  6874   mark_vectorlike (&ptr->header);
  6875   mark_face_cache (f->face_cache);
  6876 #ifdef HAVE_WINDOW_SYSTEM
  6877   if (FRAME_WINDOW_P (f) && FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f))
  6878     {
  6879       struct font *font = FRAME_FONT (f);
  6880 
  6881       if (font && !vectorlike_marked_p (&font->header))
  6882         mark_vectorlike (&font->header);
  6883     }
  6884 #endif
  6885 }
  6886 
  6887 static void
  6888 mark_window (struct Lisp_Vector *ptr)
  6889 {
  6890   struct window *w = (struct window *) ptr;
  6891 
  6892   mark_vectorlike (&ptr->header);
  6893 
  6894   /* Mark glyph matrices, if any.  Marking window
  6895      matrices is sufficient because frame matrices
  6896      use the same glyph memory.  */
  6897   if (w->current_matrix)
  6898     {
  6899       mark_glyph_matrix (w->current_matrix);
  6900       mark_glyph_matrix (w->desired_matrix);
  6901     }
  6902 
  6903   /* Filter out killed buffers from both buffer lists
  6904      in attempt to help GC to reclaim killed buffers faster.
  6905      We can do it elsewhere for live windows, but this is the
  6906      best place to do it for dead windows.  */
  6907   wset_prev_buffers
  6908     (w, mark_discard_killed_buffers (w->prev_buffers));
  6909   wset_next_buffers
  6910     (w, mark_discard_killed_buffers (w->next_buffers));
  6911 }
  6912 
  6913 /* Entry of the mark stack.  */
  6914 struct mark_entry
  6915 {
  6916   ptrdiff_t n;                  /* number of values, or 0 if a single value */
  6917   union {
  6918     Lisp_Object value;          /* when n = 0 */
  6919     Lisp_Object *values;        /* when n > 0 */
  6920   } u;
  6921 };
  6922 
  6923 /* This stack is used during marking for traversing data structures without
  6924    using C recursion.  */
  6925 struct mark_stack
  6926 {
  6927   struct mark_entry *stack;     /* base of stack */
  6928   ptrdiff_t size;               /* allocated size in entries */
  6929   ptrdiff_t sp;                 /* current number of entries */
  6930 };
  6931 
  6932 static struct mark_stack mark_stk = {NULL, 0, 0};
  6933 
  6934 static inline bool
  6935 mark_stack_empty_p (void)
  6936 {
  6937   return mark_stk.sp <= 0;
  6938 }
  6939 
  6940 /* Pop and return a value from the mark stack (which must be nonempty).  */
  6941 static inline Lisp_Object
  6942 mark_stack_pop (void)
  6943 {
  6944   eassume (!mark_stack_empty_p ());
  6945   struct mark_entry *e = &mark_stk.stack[mark_stk.sp - 1];
  6946   if (e->n == 0)                /* single value */
  6947     {
  6948       --mark_stk.sp;
  6949       return e->u.value;
  6950     }
  6951   /* Array of values: pop them left to right, which seems to be slightly
  6952      faster than right to left.  */
  6953   e->n--;
  6954   if (e->n == 0)
  6955     --mark_stk.sp;              /* last value consumed */
  6956   return (++e->u.values)[-1];
  6957 }
  6958 
  6959 NO_INLINE static void
  6960 grow_mark_stack (void)
  6961 {
  6962   struct mark_stack *ms = &mark_stk;
  6963   eassert (ms->sp == ms->size);
  6964   ptrdiff_t min_incr = ms->sp == 0 ? 8192 : 1;
  6965   ms->stack = xpalloc (ms->stack, &ms->size, min_incr, -1, sizeof *ms->stack);
  6966   eassert (ms->sp < ms->size);
  6967 }
  6968 
  6969 /* Push VALUE onto the mark stack.  */
  6970 static inline void
  6971 mark_stack_push_value (Lisp_Object value)
  6972 {
  6973   if (mark_stk.sp >= mark_stk.size)
  6974     grow_mark_stack ();
  6975   mark_stk.stack[mark_stk.sp++] = (struct mark_entry){.n = 0, .u.value = value};
  6976 }
  6977 
  6978 /* Push the N values at VALUES onto the mark stack.  */
  6979 static inline void
  6980 mark_stack_push_values (Lisp_Object *values, ptrdiff_t n)
  6981 {
  6982   eassume (n >= 0);
  6983   if (n == 0)
  6984     return;
  6985   if (mark_stk.sp >= mark_stk.size)
  6986     grow_mark_stack ();
  6987   mark_stk.stack[mark_stk.sp++] = (struct mark_entry){.n = n,
  6988                                                       .u.values = values};
  6989 }
  6990 
  6991 /* Traverse and mark objects on the mark stack above BASE_SP.
  6992 
  6993    Traversal is depth-first using the mark stack for most common
  6994    object types.  Recursion is used for other types, in the hope that
  6995    they are rare enough that C stack usage is kept low.  */
  6996 static void
  6997 process_mark_stack (ptrdiff_t base_sp)
  6998 {
  6999 #if GC_CHECK_MARKED_OBJECTS
  7000   struct mem_node *m = NULL;
  7001 #endif
  7002 #if GC_CDR_COUNT
  7003   ptrdiff_t cdr_count = 0;
  7004 #endif
  7005 
  7006   eassume (mark_stk.sp >= base_sp && base_sp >= 0);
  7007 
  7008   while (mark_stk.sp > base_sp)
  7009     {
  7010       Lisp_Object obj = mark_stack_pop ();
  7011     mark_obj: ;
  7012       void *po = XPNTR (obj);
  7013       if (PURE_P (po))
  7014         continue;
  7015 
  7016 #if GC_REMEMBER_LAST_MARKED
  7017       last_marked[last_marked_index++] = obj;
  7018       last_marked_index &= LAST_MARKED_SIZE - 1;
  7019 #endif
  7020 
  7021       /* Perform some sanity checks on the objects marked here.  Abort if
  7022          we encounter an object we know is bogus.  This increases GC time
  7023          by ~80%.  */
  7024 #if GC_CHECK_MARKED_OBJECTS
  7025 
  7026       /* Check that the object pointed to by PO is known to be a Lisp
  7027          structure allocated from the heap.  */
  7028 #define CHECK_ALLOCATED()                       \
  7029       do {                                      \
  7030         if (pdumper_object_p (po))              \
  7031           {                                     \
  7032             if (!pdumper_object_p_precise (po)) \
  7033               emacs_abort ();                   \
  7034             break;                              \
  7035           }                                     \
  7036         m = mem_find (po);                      \
  7037         if (m == MEM_NIL)                       \
  7038           emacs_abort ();                       \
  7039       } while (0)
  7040 
  7041       /* Check that the object pointed to by PO is live, using predicate
  7042          function LIVEP.  */
  7043 #define CHECK_LIVE(LIVEP, MEM_TYPE)                     \
  7044       do {                                              \
  7045         if (pdumper_object_p (po))                      \
  7046           break;                                        \
  7047         if (! (m->type == MEM_TYPE && LIVEP (m, po)))   \
  7048           emacs_abort ();                               \
  7049       } while (0)
  7050 
  7051       /* Check both of the above conditions, for non-symbols.  */
  7052 #define CHECK_ALLOCATED_AND_LIVE(LIVEP, MEM_TYPE)       \
  7053       do {                                              \
  7054         CHECK_ALLOCATED ();                             \
  7055         CHECK_LIVE (LIVEP, MEM_TYPE);                   \
  7056       } while (false)
  7057 
  7058       /* Check both of the above conditions, for symbols.  */
  7059 #define CHECK_ALLOCATED_AND_LIVE_SYMBOL()                       \
  7060       do {                                                      \
  7061         if (!c_symbol_p (ptr))                                  \
  7062           {                                                     \
  7063             CHECK_ALLOCATED ();                                 \
  7064             CHECK_LIVE (live_symbol_p, MEM_TYPE_SYMBOL);        \
  7065           }                                                     \
  7066       } while (false)
  7067 
  7068 #else /* not GC_CHECK_MARKED_OBJECTS */
  7069 
  7070 #define CHECK_ALLOCATED_AND_LIVE(LIVEP, MEM_TYPE)       ((void) 0)
  7071 #define CHECK_ALLOCATED_AND_LIVE_SYMBOL()               ((void) 0)
  7072 
  7073 #endif /* not GC_CHECK_MARKED_OBJECTS */
  7074 
  7075       switch (XTYPE (obj))
  7076         {
  7077         case Lisp_String:
  7078           {
  7079             register struct Lisp_String *ptr = XSTRING (obj);
  7080             if (string_marked_p (ptr))
  7081               break;
  7082             CHECK_ALLOCATED_AND_LIVE (live_string_p, MEM_TYPE_STRING);
  7083             set_string_marked (ptr);
  7084             mark_interval_tree (ptr->u.s.intervals);
  7085 #ifdef GC_CHECK_STRING_BYTES
  7086             /* Check that the string size recorded in the string is the
  7087                same as the one recorded in the sdata structure.  */
  7088             string_bytes (ptr);
  7089 #endif /* GC_CHECK_STRING_BYTES */
  7090           }
  7091           break;
  7092 
  7093         case Lisp_Vectorlike:
  7094           {
  7095             register struct Lisp_Vector *ptr = XVECTOR (obj);
  7096 
  7097             if (vector_marked_p (ptr))
  7098               break;
  7099 
  7100             enum pvec_type pvectype
  7101               = PSEUDOVECTOR_TYPE (ptr);
  7102 
  7103 #ifdef GC_CHECK_MARKED_OBJECTS
  7104             if (!pdumper_object_p (po) && !SUBRP (obj) && !main_thread_p (po))
  7105               {
  7106                 m = mem_find (po);
  7107                 if (m == MEM_NIL)
  7108                   emacs_abort ();
  7109                 if (m->type == MEM_TYPE_VECTORLIKE)
  7110                   CHECK_LIVE (live_large_vector_p, MEM_TYPE_VECTORLIKE);
  7111                 else
  7112                   CHECK_LIVE (live_small_vector_p, MEM_TYPE_VECTOR_BLOCK);
  7113               }
  7114 #endif
  7115 
  7116             switch (pvectype)
  7117               {
  7118               case PVEC_BUFFER:
  7119                 mark_buffer ((struct buffer *) ptr);
  7120                 break;
  7121 
  7122               case PVEC_FRAME:
  7123                 mark_frame (ptr);
  7124                 break;
  7125 
  7126               case PVEC_WINDOW:
  7127                 mark_window (ptr);
  7128                 break;
  7129 
  7130               case PVEC_HASH_TABLE:
  7131                 {
  7132                   struct Lisp_Hash_Table *h = (struct Lisp_Hash_Table *)ptr;
  7133                   ptrdiff_t size = ptr->header.size & PSEUDOVECTOR_SIZE_MASK;
  7134                   set_vector_marked (ptr);
  7135                   mark_stack_push_values (ptr->contents, size);
  7136                   mark_stack_push_value (h->test.name);
  7137                   mark_stack_push_value (h->test.user_hash_function);
  7138                   mark_stack_push_value (h->test.user_cmp_function);
  7139                   if (NILP (h->weak))
  7140                     mark_stack_push_value (h->key_and_value);
  7141                   else
  7142                     {
  7143                       /* For weak tables, mark only the vector and not its
  7144                          contents --- that's what makes it weak.  */
  7145                       eassert (h->next_weak == NULL);
  7146                       h->next_weak = weak_hash_tables;
  7147                       weak_hash_tables = h;
  7148                       set_vector_marked (XVECTOR (h->key_and_value));
  7149                     }
  7150                   break;
  7151                 }
  7152 
  7153               case PVEC_CHAR_TABLE:
  7154               case PVEC_SUB_CHAR_TABLE:
  7155                 mark_char_table (ptr, (enum pvec_type) pvectype);
  7156                 break;
  7157 
  7158               case PVEC_BOOL_VECTOR:
  7159                 /* bool vectors in a dump are permanently "marked", since
  7160                    they're in the old section and don't have mark bits.
  7161                    If we're looking at a dumped bool vector, we should
  7162                    have aborted above when we called vector_marked_p, so
  7163                    we should never get here.  */
  7164                 eassert (!pdumper_object_p (ptr));
  7165                 set_vector_marked (ptr);
  7166                 break;
  7167 
  7168               case PVEC_OVERLAY:
  7169                 mark_overlay (XOVERLAY (obj));
  7170                 break;
  7171 
  7172               case PVEC_SUBR:
  7173 #ifdef HAVE_NATIVE_COMP
  7174                 if (SUBR_NATIVE_COMPILEDP (obj))
  7175                   {
  7176                     set_vector_marked (ptr);
  7177                     struct Lisp_Subr *subr = XSUBR (obj);
  7178                     mark_stack_push_value (subr->intspec.native);
  7179                     mark_stack_push_value (subr->command_modes);
  7180                     mark_stack_push_value (subr->native_comp_u);
  7181                     mark_stack_push_value (subr->lambda_list);
  7182                     mark_stack_push_value (subr->type);
  7183                   }
  7184 #endif
  7185                 break;
  7186 
  7187               case PVEC_FREE:
  7188                 emacs_abort ();
  7189 
  7190               default:
  7191                 {
  7192                   /* A regular vector or pseudovector needing no special
  7193                      treatment.  */
  7194                   ptrdiff_t size = ptr->header.size;
  7195                   if (size & PSEUDOVECTOR_FLAG)
  7196                     size &= PSEUDOVECTOR_SIZE_MASK;
  7197                   set_vector_marked (ptr);
  7198                   mark_stack_push_values (ptr->contents, size);
  7199                 }
  7200                 break;
  7201               }
  7202           }
  7203           break;
  7204 
  7205         case Lisp_Symbol:
  7206           {
  7207             struct Lisp_Symbol *ptr = XBARE_SYMBOL (obj);
  7208           nextsym:
  7209             if (symbol_marked_p (ptr))
  7210               break;
  7211             CHECK_ALLOCATED_AND_LIVE_SYMBOL ();
  7212             set_symbol_marked (ptr);
  7213             /* Attempt to catch bogus objects.  */
  7214             eassert (valid_lisp_object_p (ptr->u.s.function));
  7215             mark_stack_push_value (ptr->u.s.function);
  7216             mark_stack_push_value (ptr->u.s.plist);
  7217             switch (ptr->u.s.redirect)
  7218               {
  7219               case SYMBOL_PLAINVAL:
  7220                 mark_stack_push_value (SYMBOL_VAL (ptr));
  7221                 break;
  7222               case SYMBOL_VARALIAS:
  7223                 {
  7224                   Lisp_Object tem;
  7225                   XSETSYMBOL (tem, SYMBOL_ALIAS (ptr));
  7226                   mark_stack_push_value (tem);
  7227                   break;
  7228                 }
  7229               case SYMBOL_LOCALIZED:
  7230                 mark_localized_symbol (ptr);
  7231                 break;
  7232               case SYMBOL_FORWARDED:
  7233                 /* If the value is forwarded to a buffer or keyboard field,
  7234                    these are marked when we see the corresponding object.
  7235                    And if it's forwarded to a C variable, either it's not
  7236                    a Lisp_Object var, or it's staticpro'd already.  */
  7237                 break;
  7238               default: emacs_abort ();
  7239               }
  7240             if (!PURE_P (XSTRING (ptr->u.s.name)))
  7241               set_string_marked (XSTRING (ptr->u.s.name));
  7242             mark_interval_tree (string_intervals (ptr->u.s.name));
  7243             /* Inner loop to mark next symbol in this bucket, if any.  */
  7244             po = ptr = ptr->u.s.next;
  7245             if (ptr)
  7246               goto nextsym;
  7247           }
  7248           break;
  7249 
  7250         case Lisp_Cons:
  7251           {
  7252             struct Lisp_Cons *ptr = XCONS (obj);
  7253             if (cons_marked_p (ptr))
  7254               break;
  7255             CHECK_ALLOCATED_AND_LIVE (live_cons_p, MEM_TYPE_CONS);
  7256             set_cons_marked (ptr);
  7257             /* Avoid growing the stack if the cdr is nil.
  7258                In any case, make sure the car is expanded first.  */
  7259             if (!NILP (ptr->u.s.u.cdr))
  7260               {
  7261                 mark_stack_push_value (ptr->u.s.u.cdr);
  7262 #if GC_CDR_COUNT
  7263                 cdr_count++;
  7264                 if (cdr_count == mark_object_loop_halt)
  7265                   emacs_abort ();
  7266 #endif
  7267               }
  7268             /* Speedup hack for the common case (successive list elements).  */
  7269             obj = ptr->u.s.car;
  7270             goto mark_obj;
  7271           }
  7272 
  7273         case Lisp_Float:
  7274           CHECK_ALLOCATED_AND_LIVE (live_float_p, MEM_TYPE_FLOAT);
  7275           /* Do not mark floats stored in a dump image: these floats are
  7276              "cold" and do not have mark bits.  */
  7277           if (pdumper_object_p (XFLOAT (obj)))
  7278             eassert (pdumper_cold_object_p (XFLOAT (obj)));
  7279           else if (!XFLOAT_MARKED_P (XFLOAT (obj)))
  7280             XFLOAT_MARK (XFLOAT (obj));
  7281           break;
  7282 
  7283         case_Lisp_Int:
  7284           break;
  7285 
  7286         default:
  7287           emacs_abort ();
  7288         }
  7289     }
  7290 
  7291 #undef CHECK_LIVE
  7292 #undef CHECK_ALLOCATED
  7293 #undef CHECK_ALLOCATED_AND_LIVE
  7294 }
  7295 
  7296 void
  7297 mark_object (Lisp_Object obj)
  7298 {
  7299   ptrdiff_t sp = mark_stk.sp;
  7300   mark_stack_push_value (obj);
  7301   process_mark_stack (sp);
  7302 }
  7303 
  7304 void
  7305 mark_objects (Lisp_Object *objs, ptrdiff_t n)
  7306 {
  7307   ptrdiff_t sp = mark_stk.sp;
  7308   mark_stack_push_values (objs, n);
  7309   process_mark_stack (sp);
  7310 }
  7311 
  7312 /* Mark the Lisp pointers in the terminal objects.
  7313    Called by Fgarbage_collect.  */
  7314 
  7315 static void
  7316 mark_terminals (void)
  7317 {
  7318   struct terminal *t;
  7319   for (t = terminal_list; t; t = t->next_terminal)
  7320     {
  7321       eassert (t->name != NULL);
  7322 #ifdef HAVE_WINDOW_SYSTEM
  7323       /* If a terminal object is reachable from a stacpro'ed object,
  7324          it might have been marked already.  Make sure the image cache
  7325          gets marked.  */
  7326       mark_image_cache (t->image_cache);
  7327 #endif /* HAVE_WINDOW_SYSTEM */
  7328       if (!vectorlike_marked_p (&t->header))
  7329         mark_vectorlike (&t->header);
  7330     }
  7331 }
  7332 
  7333 /* Value is non-zero if OBJ will survive the current GC because it's
  7334    either marked or does not need to be marked to survive.  */
  7335 
  7336 bool
  7337 survives_gc_p (Lisp_Object obj)
  7338 {
  7339   bool survives_p;
  7340 
  7341   switch (XTYPE (obj))
  7342     {
  7343     case_Lisp_Int:
  7344       survives_p = true;
  7345       break;
  7346 
  7347     case Lisp_Symbol:
  7348       survives_p = symbol_marked_p (XBARE_SYMBOL (obj));
  7349       break;
  7350 
  7351     case Lisp_String:
  7352       survives_p = string_marked_p (XSTRING (obj));
  7353       break;
  7354 
  7355     case Lisp_Vectorlike:
  7356       survives_p =
  7357         (SUBRP (obj) && !SUBR_NATIVE_COMPILEDP (obj)) ||
  7358         vector_marked_p (XVECTOR (obj));
  7359       break;
  7360 
  7361     case Lisp_Cons:
  7362       survives_p = cons_marked_p (XCONS (obj));
  7363       break;
  7364 
  7365     case Lisp_Float:
  7366       survives_p =
  7367         XFLOAT_MARKED_P (XFLOAT (obj)) ||
  7368         pdumper_object_p (XFLOAT (obj));
  7369       break;
  7370 
  7371     default:
  7372       emacs_abort ();
  7373     }
  7374 
  7375   return survives_p || PURE_P (XPNTR (obj));
  7376 }
  7377 
  7378 
  7379 
  7380 
  7381 NO_INLINE /* For better stack traces */
  7382 static void
  7383 sweep_conses (void)
  7384 {
  7385   struct cons_block **cprev = &cons_block;
  7386   int lim = cons_block_index;
  7387   object_ct num_free = 0, num_used = 0;
  7388 
  7389   cons_free_list = 0;
  7390 
  7391   for (struct cons_block *cblk; (cblk = *cprev); )
  7392     {
  7393       int i = 0;
  7394       int this_free = 0;
  7395       int ilim = (lim + BITS_PER_BITS_WORD - 1) / BITS_PER_BITS_WORD;
  7396 
  7397       /* Scan the mark bits an int at a time.  */
  7398       for (i = 0; i < ilim; i++)
  7399         {
  7400           if (cblk->gcmarkbits[i] == BITS_WORD_MAX)
  7401             {
  7402               /* Fast path - all cons cells for this int are marked.  */
  7403               cblk->gcmarkbits[i] = 0;
  7404               num_used += BITS_PER_BITS_WORD;
  7405             }
  7406           else
  7407             {
  7408               /* Some cons cells for this int are not marked.
  7409                  Find which ones, and free them.  */
  7410               int start, pos, stop;
  7411 
  7412               start = i * BITS_PER_BITS_WORD;
  7413               stop = lim - start;
  7414               if (stop > BITS_PER_BITS_WORD)
  7415                 stop = BITS_PER_BITS_WORD;
  7416               stop += start;
  7417 
  7418               for (pos = start; pos < stop; pos++)
  7419                 {
  7420                   struct Lisp_Cons *acons = &cblk->conses[pos];
  7421                   if (!XCONS_MARKED_P (acons))
  7422                     {
  7423                       ASAN_UNPOISON_CONS (&cblk->conses[pos]);
  7424                       this_free++;
  7425                       cblk->conses[pos].u.s.u.chain = cons_free_list;
  7426                       cons_free_list = &cblk->conses[pos];
  7427                       cons_free_list->u.s.car = dead_object ();
  7428                       ASAN_POISON_CONS (&cblk->conses[pos]);
  7429                     }
  7430                   else
  7431                     {
  7432                       num_used++;
  7433                       XUNMARK_CONS (acons);
  7434                     }
  7435                 }
  7436             }
  7437         }
  7438 
  7439       lim = CONS_BLOCK_SIZE;
  7440       /* If this block contains only free conses and we have already
  7441          seen more than two blocks worth of free conses then deallocate
  7442          this block.  */
  7443       if (this_free == CONS_BLOCK_SIZE && num_free > CONS_BLOCK_SIZE)
  7444         {
  7445           *cprev = cblk->next;
  7446           /* Unhook from the free list.  */
  7447           ASAN_UNPOISON_CONS (&cblk->conses[0]);
  7448           cons_free_list = cblk->conses[0].u.s.u.chain;
  7449           lisp_align_free (cblk);
  7450         }
  7451       else
  7452         {
  7453           num_free += this_free;
  7454           cprev = &cblk->next;
  7455         }
  7456     }
  7457   gcstat.total_conses = num_used;
  7458   gcstat.total_free_conses = num_free;
  7459 }
  7460 
  7461 NO_INLINE /* For better stack traces */
  7462 static void
  7463 sweep_floats (void)
  7464 {
  7465   struct float_block **fprev = &float_block;
  7466   int lim = float_block_index;
  7467   object_ct num_free = 0, num_used = 0;
  7468 
  7469   float_free_list = 0;
  7470 
  7471   for (struct float_block *fblk; (fblk = *fprev); )
  7472     {
  7473       int this_free = 0;
  7474       ASAN_UNPOISON_FLOAT_BLOCK (fblk);
  7475       for (int i = 0; i < lim; i++)
  7476         {
  7477           struct Lisp_Float *afloat = &fblk->floats[i];
  7478           if (!XFLOAT_MARKED_P (afloat))
  7479             {
  7480               this_free++;
  7481               fblk->floats[i].u.chain = float_free_list;
  7482               ASAN_POISON_FLOAT (&fblk->floats[i]);
  7483               float_free_list = &fblk->floats[i];
  7484             }
  7485           else
  7486             {
  7487               num_used++;
  7488               XFLOAT_UNMARK (afloat);
  7489             }
  7490         }
  7491       lim = FLOAT_BLOCK_SIZE;
  7492       /* If this block contains only free floats and we have already
  7493          seen more than two blocks worth of free floats then deallocate
  7494          this block.  */
  7495       if (this_free == FLOAT_BLOCK_SIZE && num_free > FLOAT_BLOCK_SIZE)
  7496         {
  7497           *fprev = fblk->next;
  7498           /* Unhook from the free list.  */
  7499           ASAN_UNPOISON_FLOAT (&fblk->floats[0]);
  7500           float_free_list = fblk->floats[0].u.chain;
  7501           lisp_align_free (fblk);
  7502         }
  7503       else
  7504         {
  7505           num_free += this_free;
  7506           fprev = &fblk->next;
  7507         }
  7508     }
  7509   gcstat.total_floats = num_used;
  7510   gcstat.total_free_floats = num_free;
  7511 }
  7512 
  7513 NO_INLINE /* For better stack traces */
  7514 static void
  7515 sweep_intervals (void)
  7516 {
  7517   struct interval_block **iprev = &interval_block;
  7518   int lim = interval_block_index;
  7519   object_ct num_free = 0, num_used = 0;
  7520 
  7521   interval_free_list = 0;
  7522 
  7523   for (struct interval_block *iblk; (iblk = *iprev); )
  7524     {
  7525       int this_free = 0;
  7526       ASAN_UNPOISON_INTERVAL_BLOCK (iblk);
  7527       for (int i = 0; i < lim; i++)
  7528         {
  7529           if (!iblk->intervals[i].gcmarkbit)
  7530             {
  7531               set_interval_parent (&iblk->intervals[i], interval_free_list);
  7532               interval_free_list = &iblk->intervals[i];
  7533               ASAN_POISON_INTERVAL (&iblk->intervals[i]);
  7534               this_free++;
  7535             }
  7536           else
  7537             {
  7538               num_used++;
  7539               iblk->intervals[i].gcmarkbit = 0;
  7540             }
  7541         }
  7542       lim = INTERVAL_BLOCK_SIZE;
  7543       /* If this block contains only free intervals and we have already
  7544          seen more than two blocks worth of free intervals then
  7545          deallocate this block.  */
  7546       if (this_free == INTERVAL_BLOCK_SIZE && num_free > INTERVAL_BLOCK_SIZE)
  7547         {
  7548           *iprev = iblk->next;
  7549           /* Unhook from the free list.  */
  7550           ASAN_UNPOISON_INTERVAL (&iblk->intervals[0]);
  7551           interval_free_list = INTERVAL_PARENT (&iblk->intervals[0]);
  7552           lisp_free (iblk);
  7553         }
  7554       else
  7555         {
  7556           num_free += this_free;
  7557           iprev = &iblk->next;
  7558         }
  7559     }
  7560   gcstat.total_intervals = num_used;
  7561   gcstat.total_free_intervals = num_free;
  7562 }
  7563 
  7564 NO_INLINE /* For better stack traces */
  7565 static void
  7566 sweep_symbols (void)
  7567 {
  7568   struct symbol_block *sblk;
  7569   struct symbol_block **sprev = &symbol_block;
  7570   int lim = symbol_block_index;
  7571   object_ct num_free = 0, num_used = ARRAYELTS (lispsym);
  7572 
  7573   symbol_free_list = NULL;
  7574 
  7575   for (int i = 0; i < ARRAYELTS (lispsym); i++)
  7576     lispsym[i].u.s.gcmarkbit = 0;
  7577 
  7578   for (sblk = symbol_block; sblk; sblk = *sprev)
  7579     {
  7580       ASAN_UNPOISON_SYMBOL_BLOCK (sblk);
  7581 
  7582       int this_free = 0;
  7583       struct Lisp_Symbol *sym = sblk->symbols;
  7584       struct Lisp_Symbol *end = sym + lim;
  7585 
  7586       for (; sym < end; ++sym)
  7587         {
  7588           if (!sym->u.s.gcmarkbit)
  7589             {
  7590               if (sym->u.s.redirect == SYMBOL_LOCALIZED)
  7591                 {
  7592                   xfree (SYMBOL_BLV (sym));
  7593                   /* At every GC we sweep all symbol_blocks and rebuild the
  7594                      symbol_free_list, so those symbols which stayed unused
  7595                      between the two will be re-swept.
  7596                      So we have to make sure we don't re-free this blv next
  7597                      time we sweep this symbol_block (bug#29066).  */
  7598                   sym->u.s.redirect = SYMBOL_PLAINVAL;
  7599                 }
  7600               sym->u.s.next = symbol_free_list;
  7601               symbol_free_list = sym;
  7602               symbol_free_list->u.s.function = dead_object ();
  7603               ASAN_POISON_SYMBOL (sym);
  7604               ++this_free;
  7605             }
  7606           else
  7607             {
  7608               ++num_used;
  7609               sym->u.s.gcmarkbit = 0;
  7610               /* Attempt to catch bogus objects.  */
  7611               eassert (valid_lisp_object_p (sym->u.s.function));
  7612             }
  7613         }
  7614 
  7615       lim = SYMBOL_BLOCK_SIZE;
  7616       /* If this block contains only free symbols and we have already
  7617          seen more than two blocks worth of free symbols then deallocate
  7618          this block.  */
  7619       if (this_free == SYMBOL_BLOCK_SIZE && num_free > SYMBOL_BLOCK_SIZE)
  7620         {
  7621           *sprev = sblk->next;
  7622           /* Unhook from the free list.  */
  7623           ASAN_UNPOISON_SYMBOL (&sblk->symbols[0]);
  7624           symbol_free_list = sblk->symbols[0].u.s.next;
  7625           lisp_free (sblk);
  7626         }
  7627       else
  7628         {
  7629           num_free += this_free;
  7630           sprev = &sblk->next;
  7631         }
  7632     }
  7633   gcstat.total_symbols = num_used;
  7634   gcstat.total_free_symbols = num_free;
  7635 }
  7636 
  7637 /* Remove BUFFER's markers that are due to be swept.  This is needed since
  7638    we treat BUF_MARKERS and markers's `next' field as weak pointers.  */
  7639 static void
  7640 unchain_dead_markers (struct buffer *buffer)
  7641 {
  7642   struct Lisp_Marker *this, **prev = &BUF_MARKERS (buffer);
  7643 
  7644   while ((this = *prev))
  7645     if (vectorlike_marked_p (&this->header))
  7646       prev = &this->next;
  7647     else
  7648       {
  7649         this->buffer = NULL;
  7650         *prev = this->next;
  7651       }
  7652 }
  7653 
  7654 NO_INLINE /* For better stack traces */
  7655 static void
  7656 sweep_buffers (void)
  7657 {
  7658   Lisp_Object tail, buf;
  7659 
  7660   gcstat.total_buffers = 0;
  7661   FOR_EACH_LIVE_BUFFER (tail, buf)
  7662     {
  7663       struct buffer *buffer = XBUFFER (buf);
  7664       /* Do not use buffer_(set|get)_intervals here.  */
  7665       buffer->text->intervals = balance_intervals (buffer->text->intervals);
  7666       unchain_dead_markers (buffer);
  7667       gcstat.total_buffers++;
  7668     }
  7669 }
  7670 
  7671 /* Sweep: find all structures not marked, and free them.  */
  7672 static void
  7673 gc_sweep (void)
  7674 {
  7675   sweep_strings ();
  7676   check_string_bytes (!noninteractive);
  7677   sweep_conses ();
  7678   sweep_floats ();
  7679   sweep_intervals ();
  7680   sweep_symbols ();
  7681   sweep_buffers ();
  7682   sweep_vectors ();
  7683   pdumper_clear_marks ();
  7684   check_string_bytes (!noninteractive);
  7685 }
  7686 
  7687 DEFUN ("memory-info", Fmemory_info, Smemory_info, 0, 0, 0,
  7688        doc: /* Return a list of (TOTAL-RAM FREE-RAM TOTAL-SWAP FREE-SWAP).
  7689 All values are in Kbytes.  If there is no swap space,
  7690 last two values are zero.  If the system is not supported
  7691 or memory information can't be obtained, return nil.
  7692 If `default-directory' is remote, return memory information of the
  7693 respective remote host.  */)
  7694   (void)
  7695 {
  7696   Lisp_Object handler
  7697     = Ffind_file_name_handler (BVAR (current_buffer, directory),
  7698                                Qmemory_info);
  7699   if (!NILP (handler))
  7700     return call1 (handler, Qmemory_info);
  7701 
  7702 #if defined HAVE_LINUX_SYSINFO
  7703   struct sysinfo si;
  7704   uintmax_t units;
  7705 
  7706   if (sysinfo (&si))
  7707     return Qnil;
  7708 #ifdef LINUX_SYSINFO_UNIT
  7709   units = si.mem_unit;
  7710 #else
  7711   units = 1;
  7712 #endif
  7713   return list4i ((uintmax_t) si.totalram * units / 1024,
  7714                  (uintmax_t) si.freeram * units / 1024,
  7715                  (uintmax_t) si.totalswap * units / 1024,
  7716                  (uintmax_t) si.freeswap * units / 1024);
  7717 #elif defined WINDOWSNT
  7718   unsigned long long totalram, freeram, totalswap, freeswap;
  7719 
  7720   if (w32_memory_info (&totalram, &freeram, &totalswap, &freeswap) == 0)
  7721     return list4i ((uintmax_t) totalram / 1024,
  7722                    (uintmax_t) freeram / 1024,
  7723                    (uintmax_t) totalswap / 1024,
  7724                    (uintmax_t) freeswap / 1024);
  7725   else
  7726     return Qnil;
  7727 #elif defined MSDOS
  7728   unsigned long totalram, freeram, totalswap, freeswap;
  7729 
  7730   if (dos_memory_info (&totalram, &freeram, &totalswap, &freeswap) == 0)
  7731     return list4i ((uintmax_t) totalram / 1024,
  7732                    (uintmax_t) freeram / 1024,
  7733                    (uintmax_t) totalswap / 1024,
  7734                    (uintmax_t) freeswap / 1024);
  7735   else
  7736     return Qnil;
  7737 #else /* not HAVE_LINUX_SYSINFO, not WINDOWSNT, not MSDOS */
  7738   /* FIXME: add more systems.  */
  7739   return Qnil;
  7740 #endif /* HAVE_LINUX_SYSINFO, not WINDOWSNT, not MSDOS */
  7741 }
  7742 
  7743 /* Debugging aids.  */
  7744 
  7745 DEFUN ("memory-use-counts", Fmemory_use_counts, Smemory_use_counts, 0, 0, 0,
  7746        doc: /* Return a list of counters that measure how much consing there has been.
  7747 Each of these counters increments for a certain kind of object.
  7748 The counters wrap around from the largest positive integer to zero.
  7749 Garbage collection does not decrease them.
  7750 The elements of the value are as follows:
  7751   (CONSES FLOATS VECTOR-CELLS SYMBOLS STRING-CHARS INTERVALS STRINGS)
  7752 All are in units of 1 = one object consed
  7753 except for VECTOR-CELLS and STRING-CHARS, which count the total length of
  7754 objects consed.
  7755 Frames, windows, buffers, and subprocesses count as vectors
  7756   (but the contents of a buffer's text do not count here).  */)
  7757   (void)
  7758 {
  7759   return  list (make_int (cons_cells_consed),
  7760                 make_int (floats_consed),
  7761                 make_int (vector_cells_consed),
  7762                 make_int (symbols_consed),
  7763                 make_int (string_chars_consed),
  7764                 make_int (intervals_consed),
  7765                 make_int (strings_consed));
  7766 }
  7767 
  7768 #if defined GNU_LINUX && defined __GLIBC__ && \
  7769   (__GLIBC__ > 2 || __GLIBC_MINOR__ >= 10)
  7770 DEFUN ("malloc-info", Fmalloc_info, Smalloc_info, 0, 0, "",
  7771        doc: /* Report malloc information to stderr.
  7772 This function outputs to stderr an XML-formatted
  7773 description of the current state of the memory-allocation
  7774 arenas.  */)
  7775   (void)
  7776 {
  7777   if (malloc_info (0, stderr))
  7778     error ("malloc_info failed: %s", emacs_strerror (errno));
  7779   return Qnil;
  7780 }
  7781 #endif
  7782 
  7783 #ifdef HAVE_MALLOC_TRIM
  7784 DEFUN ("malloc-trim", Fmalloc_trim, Smalloc_trim, 0, 1, "",
  7785        doc: /* Release free heap memory to the OS.
  7786 This function asks libc to return unused heap memory back to the operating
  7787 system.  This function isn't guaranteed to do anything, and is mainly
  7788 meant as a debugging tool.
  7789 
  7790 If LEAVE_PADDING is given, ask the system to leave that much unused
  7791 space in the heap of the Emacs process.  This should be an integer, and if
  7792 not given, it defaults to 0.
  7793 
  7794 This function returns nil if no memory could be returned to the
  7795 system, and non-nil if some memory could be returned.  */)
  7796   (Lisp_Object leave_padding)
  7797 {
  7798   int pad = 0;
  7799 
  7800   if (! NILP (leave_padding))
  7801     {
  7802       CHECK_FIXNAT (leave_padding);
  7803       pad = XFIXNUM (leave_padding);
  7804     }
  7805 
  7806   /* 1 means that memory was released to the system.  */
  7807   if (malloc_trim (pad) == 1)
  7808     return Qt;
  7809   else
  7810     return Qnil;
  7811 }
  7812 #endif
  7813 
  7814 static bool
  7815 symbol_uses_obj (Lisp_Object symbol, Lisp_Object obj)
  7816 {
  7817   struct Lisp_Symbol *sym = XBARE_SYMBOL (symbol);
  7818   Lisp_Object val = find_symbol_value (symbol);
  7819   return (EQ (val, obj)
  7820           || EQ (sym->u.s.function, obj)
  7821           || (!NILP (sym->u.s.function)
  7822               && COMPILEDP (sym->u.s.function)
  7823               && EQ (AREF (sym->u.s.function, COMPILED_BYTECODE), obj))
  7824           || (!NILP (val)
  7825               && COMPILEDP (val)
  7826               && EQ (AREF (val, COMPILED_BYTECODE), obj)));
  7827 }
  7828 
  7829 /* Find at most FIND_MAX symbols which have OBJ as their value or
  7830    function.  This is used in gdbinit's `xwhichsymbols' command.  */
  7831 
  7832 Lisp_Object
  7833 which_symbols (Lisp_Object obj, EMACS_INT find_max)
  7834 {
  7835    struct symbol_block *sblk;
  7836    specpdl_ref gc_count = inhibit_garbage_collection ();
  7837    Lisp_Object found = Qnil;
  7838 
  7839    if (! deadp (obj))
  7840      {
  7841        for (int i = 0; i < ARRAYELTS (lispsym); i++)
  7842          {
  7843            Lisp_Object sym = builtin_lisp_symbol (i);
  7844            if (symbol_uses_obj (sym, obj))
  7845              {
  7846                found = Fcons (sym, found);
  7847                if (--find_max == 0)
  7848                  goto out;
  7849              }
  7850          }
  7851 
  7852        for (sblk = symbol_block; sblk; sblk = sblk->next)
  7853          {
  7854            struct Lisp_Symbol *asym = sblk->symbols;
  7855            int bn;
  7856 
  7857            for (bn = 0; bn < SYMBOL_BLOCK_SIZE; bn++, asym++)
  7858              {
  7859                if (sblk == symbol_block && bn >= symbol_block_index)
  7860                  break;
  7861 
  7862                Lisp_Object sym = make_lisp_symbol (asym);
  7863                if (symbol_uses_obj (sym, obj))
  7864                  {
  7865                    found = Fcons (sym, found);
  7866                    if (--find_max == 0)
  7867                      goto out;
  7868                  }
  7869              }
  7870          }
  7871      }
  7872 
  7873   out:
  7874    return unbind_to (gc_count, found);
  7875 }
  7876 
  7877 #ifdef SUSPICIOUS_OBJECT_CHECKING
  7878 
  7879 static void *
  7880 find_suspicious_object_in_range (void *begin, void *end)
  7881 {
  7882   char *begin_a = begin;
  7883   char *end_a = end;
  7884   int i;
  7885 
  7886   for (i = 0; i < ARRAYELTS (suspicious_objects); ++i)
  7887     {
  7888       char *suspicious_object = suspicious_objects[i];
  7889       if (begin_a <= suspicious_object && suspicious_object < end_a)
  7890         return suspicious_object;
  7891     }
  7892 
  7893   return NULL;
  7894 }
  7895 
  7896 static void
  7897 note_suspicious_free (void *ptr)
  7898 {
  7899   struct suspicious_free_record *rec;
  7900 
  7901   rec = &suspicious_free_history[suspicious_free_history_index++];
  7902   if (suspicious_free_history_index ==
  7903       ARRAYELTS (suspicious_free_history))
  7904     {
  7905       suspicious_free_history_index = 0;
  7906     }
  7907 
  7908   memset (rec, 0, sizeof (*rec));
  7909   rec->suspicious_object = ptr;
  7910   backtrace (&rec->backtrace[0], ARRAYELTS (rec->backtrace));
  7911 }
  7912 
  7913 static void
  7914 detect_suspicious_free (void *ptr)
  7915 {
  7916   int i;
  7917 
  7918   eassert (ptr != NULL);
  7919 
  7920   for (i = 0; i < ARRAYELTS (suspicious_objects); ++i)
  7921     if (suspicious_objects[i] == ptr)
  7922       {
  7923         note_suspicious_free (ptr);
  7924         suspicious_objects[i] = NULL;
  7925       }
  7926 }
  7927 
  7928 #endif /* SUSPICIOUS_OBJECT_CHECKING */
  7929 
  7930 DEFUN ("suspicious-object", Fsuspicious_object, Ssuspicious_object, 1, 1, 0,
  7931        doc: /* Return OBJ, maybe marking it for extra scrutiny.
  7932 If Emacs is compiled with suspicious object checking, capture
  7933 a stack trace when OBJ is freed in order to help track down
  7934 garbage collection bugs.  Otherwise, do nothing and return OBJ.   */)
  7935    (Lisp_Object obj)
  7936 {
  7937 #ifdef SUSPICIOUS_OBJECT_CHECKING
  7938   /* Right now, we care only about vectors.  */
  7939   if (VECTORLIKEP (obj))
  7940     {
  7941       suspicious_objects[suspicious_object_index++] = XVECTOR (obj);
  7942       if (suspicious_object_index == ARRAYELTS (suspicious_objects))
  7943         suspicious_object_index = 0;
  7944     }
  7945 #endif
  7946   return obj;
  7947 }
  7948 
  7949 #ifdef ENABLE_CHECKING
  7950 
  7951 bool suppress_checking;
  7952 
  7953 void
  7954 die (const char *msg, const char *file, int line)
  7955 {
  7956   fprintf (stderr, "\r\n%s:%d: Emacs fatal error: assertion failed: %s\r\n",
  7957            file, line, msg);
  7958   terminate_due_to_signal (SIGABRT, INT_MAX);
  7959 }
  7960 
  7961 #endif /* ENABLE_CHECKING */
  7962 
  7963 #if defined (ENABLE_CHECKING) && USE_STACK_LISP_OBJECTS
  7964 
  7965 /* Stress alloca with inconveniently sized requests and check
  7966    whether all allocated areas may be used for Lisp_Object.  */
  7967 
  7968 NO_INLINE static void
  7969 verify_alloca (void)
  7970 {
  7971   int i;
  7972   enum { ALLOCA_CHECK_MAX = 256 };
  7973   /* Start from size of the smallest Lisp object.  */
  7974   for (i = sizeof (struct Lisp_Cons); i <= ALLOCA_CHECK_MAX; i++)
  7975     {
  7976       void *ptr = alloca (i);
  7977       make_lisp_ptr (ptr, Lisp_Cons);
  7978     }
  7979 }
  7980 
  7981 #else /* not ENABLE_CHECKING && USE_STACK_LISP_OBJECTS */
  7982 
  7983 #define verify_alloca() ((void) 0)
  7984 
  7985 #endif /* ENABLE_CHECKING && USE_STACK_LISP_OBJECTS */
  7986 
  7987 /* Initialization.  */
  7988 
  7989 static void init_alloc_once_for_pdumper (void);
  7990 
  7991 void
  7992 init_alloc_once (void)
  7993 {
  7994   gc_cons_threshold = GC_DEFAULT_THRESHOLD;
  7995   /* Even though Qt's contents are not set up, its address is known.  */
  7996   Vpurify_flag = Qt;
  7997 
  7998   PDUMPER_REMEMBER_SCALAR (buffer_defaults.header);
  7999   PDUMPER_REMEMBER_SCALAR (buffer_local_symbols.header);
  8000 
  8001   /* Call init_alloc_once_for_pdumper now so we run mem_init early.
  8002      Keep in mind that when we reload from a dump, we'll run _only_
  8003      init_alloc_once_for_pdumper and not init_alloc_once at all.  */
  8004   pdumper_do_now_and_after_load (init_alloc_once_for_pdumper);
  8005 
  8006   verify_alloca ();
  8007 
  8008   init_strings ();
  8009   init_vectors ();
  8010 }
  8011 
  8012 static void
  8013 init_alloc_once_for_pdumper (void)
  8014 {
  8015   purebeg = PUREBEG;
  8016   pure_size = PURESIZE;
  8017   mem_init ();
  8018 
  8019 #ifdef DOUG_LEA_MALLOC
  8020   mallopt (M_TRIM_THRESHOLD, 128 * 1024); /* Trim threshold.  */
  8021   mallopt (M_MMAP_THRESHOLD, 64 * 1024);  /* Mmap threshold.  */
  8022   mallopt (M_MMAP_MAX, MMAP_MAX_AREAS);   /* Max. number of mmap'ed areas.  */
  8023 #endif
  8024 
  8025 
  8026   init_finalizer_list (&finalizers);
  8027   init_finalizer_list (&doomed_finalizers);
  8028   refill_memory_reserve ();
  8029 }
  8030 
  8031 void
  8032 init_alloc (void)
  8033 {
  8034   Vgc_elapsed = make_float (0.0);
  8035   gcs_done = 0;
  8036 }
  8037 
  8038 void
  8039 syms_of_alloc (void)
  8040 {
  8041   DEFVAR_INT ("gc-cons-threshold", gc_cons_threshold,
  8042               doc: /* Number of bytes of consing between garbage collections.
  8043 Garbage collection can happen automatically once this many bytes have been
  8044 allocated since the last garbage collection.  All data types count.
  8045 
  8046 Garbage collection happens automatically only when `eval' is called.
  8047 
  8048 By binding this temporarily to a large number, you can effectively
  8049 prevent garbage collection during a part of the program.  But be
  8050 sure to get back to the normal value soon enough, to avoid system-wide
  8051 memory pressure, and never use a too-high value for prolonged periods
  8052 of time.
  8053 See also `gc-cons-percentage'.  */);
  8054 
  8055   DEFVAR_LISP ("gc-cons-percentage", Vgc_cons_percentage,
  8056                doc: /* Portion of the heap used for allocation.
  8057 Garbage collection can happen automatically once this portion of the heap
  8058 has been allocated since the last garbage collection.
  8059 
  8060 By binding this temporarily to a large number, you can effectively
  8061 prevent garbage collection during a part of the program.  But be
  8062 sure to get back to the normal value soon enough, to avoid system-wide
  8063 memory pressure, and never use a too-high value for prolonged periods
  8064 of time.
  8065 
  8066 If this portion is smaller than `gc-cons-threshold', this is ignored.  */);
  8067   Vgc_cons_percentage = make_float (0.1);
  8068 
  8069   DEFVAR_INT ("pure-bytes-used", pure_bytes_used,
  8070               doc: /* Number of bytes of shareable Lisp data allocated so far.  */);
  8071 
  8072   DEFVAR_INT ("cons-cells-consed", cons_cells_consed,
  8073               doc: /* Number of cons cells that have been consed so far.  */);
  8074 
  8075   DEFVAR_INT ("floats-consed", floats_consed,
  8076               doc: /* Number of floats that have been consed so far.  */);
  8077 
  8078   DEFVAR_INT ("vector-cells-consed", vector_cells_consed,
  8079               doc: /* Number of vector cells that have been consed so far.  */);
  8080 
  8081   DEFVAR_INT ("symbols-consed", symbols_consed,
  8082               doc: /* Number of symbols that have been consed so far.  */);
  8083   symbols_consed += ARRAYELTS (lispsym);
  8084 
  8085   DEFVAR_INT ("string-chars-consed", string_chars_consed,
  8086               doc: /* Number of string characters that have been consed so far.  */);
  8087 
  8088   DEFVAR_INT ("intervals-consed", intervals_consed,
  8089               doc: /* Number of intervals that have been consed so far.  */);
  8090 
  8091   DEFVAR_INT ("strings-consed", strings_consed,
  8092               doc: /* Number of strings that have been consed so far.  */);
  8093 
  8094   DEFVAR_LISP ("purify-flag", Vpurify_flag,
  8095                doc: /* Non-nil means loading Lisp code in order to dump an executable.
  8096 This means that certain objects should be allocated in shared (pure) space.
  8097 It can also be set to a hash-table, in which case this table is used to
  8098 do hash-consing of the objects allocated to pure space.  */);
  8099 
  8100   DEFVAR_BOOL ("garbage-collection-messages", garbage_collection_messages,
  8101                doc: /* Non-nil means display messages at start and end of garbage collection.  */);
  8102   garbage_collection_messages = 0;
  8103 
  8104   DEFVAR_LISP ("post-gc-hook", Vpost_gc_hook,
  8105                doc: /* Hook run after garbage collection has finished.  */);
  8106   Vpost_gc_hook = Qnil;
  8107   DEFSYM (Qpost_gc_hook, "post-gc-hook");
  8108 
  8109   DEFVAR_LISP ("memory-signal-data", Vmemory_signal_data,
  8110                doc: /* Precomputed `signal' argument for memory-full error.  */);
  8111   /* We build this in advance because if we wait until we need it, we might
  8112      not be able to allocate the memory to hold it.  */
  8113   Vmemory_signal_data
  8114     = pure_list (Qerror,
  8115                  build_pure_c_string ("Memory exhausted--use"
  8116                                       " M-x save-some-buffers then"
  8117                                       " exit and restart Emacs"));
  8118 
  8119   DEFVAR_LISP ("memory-full", Vmemory_full,
  8120                doc: /* Non-nil means Emacs cannot get much more Lisp memory.  */);
  8121   Vmemory_full = Qnil;
  8122 
  8123   DEFSYM (Qmemory_info, "memory-info");
  8124 
  8125   DEFSYM (Qconses, "conses");
  8126   DEFSYM (Qsymbols, "symbols");
  8127   DEFSYM (Qstrings, "strings");
  8128   DEFSYM (Qvectors, "vectors");
  8129   DEFSYM (Qfloats, "floats");
  8130   DEFSYM (Qintervals, "intervals");
  8131   DEFSYM (Qbuffers, "buffers");
  8132   DEFSYM (Qstring_bytes, "string-bytes");
  8133   DEFSYM (Qvector_slots, "vector-slots");
  8134   DEFSYM (Qheap, "heap");
  8135   DEFSYM (QAutomatic_GC, "Automatic GC");
  8136 
  8137   DEFSYM (Qgc_cons_percentage, "gc-cons-percentage");
  8138   DEFSYM (Qgc_cons_threshold, "gc-cons-threshold");
  8139   DEFSYM (Qchar_table_extra_slots, "char-table-extra-slots");
  8140 
  8141   DEFVAR_LISP ("gc-elapsed", Vgc_elapsed,
  8142                doc: /* Accumulated time elapsed in garbage collections.
  8143 The time is in seconds as a floating point value.  */);
  8144   DEFVAR_INT ("gcs-done", gcs_done,
  8145               doc: /* Accumulated number of garbage collections done.  */);
  8146 
  8147   DEFVAR_INT ("integer-width", integer_width,
  8148               doc: /* Maximum number N of bits in safely-calculated integers.
  8149 Integers with absolute values less than 2**N do not signal a range error.
  8150 N should be nonnegative.  */);
  8151 
  8152   defsubr (&Scons);
  8153   defsubr (&Slist);
  8154   defsubr (&Svector);
  8155   defsubr (&Srecord);
  8156   defsubr (&Sbool_vector);
  8157   defsubr (&Smake_byte_code);
  8158   defsubr (&Smake_closure);
  8159   defsubr (&Smake_list);
  8160   defsubr (&Smake_vector);
  8161   defsubr (&Smake_record);
  8162   defsubr (&Smake_string);
  8163   defsubr (&Smake_bool_vector);
  8164   defsubr (&Smake_symbol);
  8165   defsubr (&Smake_marker);
  8166   defsubr (&Smake_finalizer);
  8167   defsubr (&Spurecopy);
  8168   defsubr (&Sgarbage_collect);
  8169   defsubr (&Sgarbage_collect_maybe);
  8170   defsubr (&Smemory_info);
  8171   defsubr (&Smemory_use_counts);
  8172 #if defined GNU_LINUX && defined __GLIBC__ && \
  8173   (__GLIBC__ > 2 || __GLIBC_MINOR__ >= 10)
  8174 
  8175   defsubr (&Smalloc_info);
  8176 #endif
  8177 #ifdef HAVE_MALLOC_TRIM
  8178   defsubr (&Smalloc_trim);
  8179 #endif
  8180   defsubr (&Ssuspicious_object);
  8181 
  8182   Lisp_Object watcher;
  8183 
  8184   static union Aligned_Lisp_Subr Swatch_gc_cons_threshold =
  8185      {{{ PSEUDOVECTOR_FLAG | (PVEC_SUBR << PSEUDOVECTOR_AREA_BITS) },
  8186        { .a4 = watch_gc_cons_threshold },
  8187        4, 4, "watch_gc_cons_threshold", {0}, lisp_h_Qnil}};
  8188   XSETSUBR (watcher, &Swatch_gc_cons_threshold.s);
  8189   Fadd_variable_watcher (Qgc_cons_threshold, watcher);
  8190 
  8191   static union Aligned_Lisp_Subr Swatch_gc_cons_percentage =
  8192      {{{ PSEUDOVECTOR_FLAG | (PVEC_SUBR << PSEUDOVECTOR_AREA_BITS) },
  8193        { .a4 = watch_gc_cons_percentage },
  8194        4, 4, "watch_gc_cons_percentage", {0}, lisp_h_Qnil}};
  8195   XSETSUBR (watcher, &Swatch_gc_cons_percentage.s);
  8196   Fadd_variable_watcher (Qgc_cons_percentage, watcher);
  8197 }
  8198 
  8199 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
  8200 enum defined_HAVE_X_WINDOWS { defined_HAVE_X_WINDOWS = true };
  8201 #else
  8202 enum defined_HAVE_X_WINDOWS { defined_HAVE_X_WINDOWS = false };
  8203 #endif
  8204 
  8205 #ifdef HAVE_PGTK
  8206 enum defined_HAVE_PGTK { defined_HAVE_PGTK = true };
  8207 #else
  8208 enum defined_HAVE_PGTK { defined_HAVE_PGTK = false };
  8209 #endif
  8210 
  8211 /* When compiled with GCC, GDB might say "No enum type named
  8212    pvec_type" if we don't have at least one symbol with that type, and
  8213    then xbacktrace could fail.  Similarly for the other enums and
  8214    their values.  Some non-GCC compilers don't like these constructs.  */
  8215 #ifdef __GNUC__
  8216 union
  8217 {
  8218   enum CHARTAB_SIZE_BITS CHARTAB_SIZE_BITS;
  8219   enum char_table_specials char_table_specials;
  8220   enum char_bits char_bits;
  8221   enum CHECK_LISP_OBJECT_TYPE CHECK_LISP_OBJECT_TYPE;
  8222   enum DEFAULT_HASH_SIZE DEFAULT_HASH_SIZE;
  8223   enum Lisp_Bits Lisp_Bits;
  8224   enum Lisp_Compiled Lisp_Compiled;
  8225   enum maxargs maxargs;
  8226   enum MAX_ALLOCA MAX_ALLOCA;
  8227   enum More_Lisp_Bits More_Lisp_Bits;
  8228   enum pvec_type pvec_type;
  8229   enum defined_HAVE_X_WINDOWS defined_HAVE_X_WINDOWS;
  8230   enum defined_HAVE_PGTK defined_HAVE_PGTK;
  8231 } const EXTERNALLY_VISIBLE gdb_make_enums_visible = {0};
  8232 #endif  /* __GNUC__ */
/* [<][>][^][v][top][bottom][index][help] */
